everyoneShouldKnow: It is a madhouse of people. If you need peace and quiet, this isn't for you
title: Majoring in Mediocrity
comment: There was nothing terrible about our stay but lots of little annoyances that add up to wishing we had been somewhere else. Our king bed reservation turned into 2 doubles and the person who checked us in insisted they were 2 queens--which is why we took the room. She should have been better informed. She also knew nothing about the gold welcome amenity and had to ask someone else. Our room had a broken safe and we had to call for service on it twice which made us late for where we were going. I had lots of trouble with the computer in the lobby, and the set-up is such that everyone in that lobby can see what you're working on. That's flat out wrong. I even get the idea of creating more energy and connectedness in the lobby by putting the work stations there, but give people a little personal privacy when they're on the computer. And the elevators took too long. Too many people coming and going--like a factory. And finally, I can't believe they are still charging $10 a day for the fitness center. Come on people. If you have to charge, make this one of the gold amenities. I didn't need that free drink. I need a workout in the morning. I am a committed BPG member but I would only stay here with points, I would never pay to stay here.

title: Not the Belvoir I Expected
comment: Beyond the exterior and lobby decor this hotel needs plenty of management work. The staff was pleasant and graceous, however, It took us 2 hours, yes TWO, to check in. During this time they did offer refreshments, but what I really wanted was to get settled. Murmurs through the crowd were they're just not prepared to handle large crowds. Are you kidding me? They sit next door to the convention center. Crowds should be their speciality. Once our room assignments were given we arrived on the 8th floor to piles of laundry on the floor outside of rooms. I was skeptical as I entered my room, which was okay. Didn't eat there as prices were exorbitant and again long lines. Check out made easy on the TV wasn't working , so back to standing in another line. Overall VERY disappointing. I've stayed at lesser hotels with more attention to the customer.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff goes above and beyond to service the guests.
title: Awesome!
comment: From the moment we checked in to the moment we left our stay here was exceptional. Jocelyn was so helpful and kind during check in. We were there for the Extrodinary Women's Conference at the BJCC so everything was right there. The only issue we had was when the conference was over was getting out of the parking garage. It took one hour to get out. Would definately recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

title: Great Stay - our dog loved it too!
comment: This was our first stay here (we were in town for a wedding)..and first time traveling with our 60lb bulldog. All in all..the stay was GREAT! We dined at the restaurant bar twice for a light lunch and the staff was incredible. So nice..accommodating...and with great big smiles on their faces. It is for them that I write this review!!

title: First impression
comment: The overall stay at the hotel was great. I was in town for a convention and the facilities were fantastic for the event.

everyoneShouldKnow: Regardless of what Tower you are in, it is a pleasant walk between the towers.
title: Terrific experience
comment: I was responsible for planning, organizing and running a 2.5 day conference for my employer and in large part the conference was a tremendous success because this Belvoir met and exceeded all expectations. Further, they kept all the promises made when I visited the hotel months earlier to "scout" locations. Did not hear on complaint from any of our 225+ guests.

title: Mrs. Hutchinson
comment: 1. Room was very small

title: Location cannot be better
comment: Travelled with my in laws + 4 year old daughter and at the end of our trip we all could not be happier.

everyoneShouldKnow: Normally it is a very good hotel and we have enjoyed many nights there.
title: Normal expectations not met
comment: We have stayed at this hotel many times and was always given the best rooms available due to our Gold Grandbourne Preferred Guest status. I will say up front, that I did not ask for an upgrade when I checked in. However, we were placed on the 3rd of 8 floors and the room was not up the standard that we are used to when staying at this or any Belvoir. If we had been staying for more than 1 night I definitely would have asked for better arrangements. No Grandbourne Gold member should ever have to ask for a better room - it should be the standard.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and decor. Nice, low key property.
title: Our Scottsdale Favorite
comment: We are Blessed to live in a beautiful little beach town in southern California. However, we enjoy Scottsdale get aways and have stayed at Kierland many times. We discovered Belvoir Desert Oasis a few years ago and will now return next week for perhaps our 7th visit. Perfect size, decor and access to all the best Scotttsdale has to offer.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is much to big so housekeeping cannot be above average. Old hotel needs a major face lift.
title: This Hotel seemed very out of date.
comment: Even with some of the updated rooms the Hotel still seemed to need some help.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a perfect location if visiting Universal Studios.
title: Disappointed in room
comment: The Facilities are very nice and the staff was accommodating and professional. The issue I had was the room and the cleanliness of the room i was in. The room was rundown, gum on the carpet, shower drain looked dirty, mildew around the sink and a long blond hair on the water closet. This is unacceptable to me. This is the first time in ten years of travel that I have ever been disappointed in a Belvoir property.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Great Hotel and very helpful personnel. Loved that the location was connected to the BJCC where a conference was being held.

title: GIVE THIS HOTEL A MISS - IT SHOULD NOT EVEN BE BRANDED Belvoir
comment: TERRIBLE SERVICE, TERRIBLE FOOD, POOR COMMUNICATION, LACK OF TRAINING AND KNOWLEDGE. THE LIST GOES ON BUT I WONT BORE YOU. FIND ANOTHER HOTEL NEAR THE AIRPORT, THERE ARE MANY AND I AM SURE THEY ARE ALL SUPERIOR TO THIS ONE. THE WORST Belvoir I HAVE EVER STAYED IN ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD. PERIOD.

title: Nice hotel and friendly staff
comment: My wife and I stayed here for one night as a date night getaway. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and the room was comfortable. The room was very quiet even though you are right next to the LAX landing approach. We had a light dinner in the lounge that was reasonable and the buffet breakfast was quite good. I would recommend this hotel for business stays and getaways. Hotel is close to the South Bay and the Marina Del Rey.

title: Room is after-thought
comment: Room is not laid out correctly, asked not to be assigned this room after last stay. Bathroom looks like its set up for handicap, but sure no handicap would stay or approve. Towel rack not near tub, no place to set towels, sink has no place to put shaving kit. Bathroom is a cluster. Room is tucked in next to elevators, door lock is not standard. Room closet is set in crazy configuration.

title: Excellent Service
comment: I would like to compliment Travis, Jason and in particular Jesus for outstanding guest service. Their assistance, going above and beyond made the week at the property a wonderful vacation for the family.

title: Fantastic.
comment: What a delightful stay I had at this Hotel. Shula's was delicious and the service was quick. The desk staff extremely accommodating and friendly. The Belvoir bed is so comfortable, I have never experienced the lack of support mentioned in previous reviews, My husband and I are actually looking into purchasing one for our home. Free shuttle downtown is Marvelous!

title: Hotel service needs improvement
comment: I was disappointed with the staff service.

title: Exceeded Expectations
comment: More than adequate room for my needs, especially at the rate. The size of the room was perfect, location was great right near major roadways.

title: Great conference location
comment: Very impressed with front desk staff. Long check in line when we arrived but they moved people through quickly and efficiently and they seemed genuinely apologetic that we had to wait any at all. We attended a 3 day conference. The hotel location is great. You walk out the door and you have a lot of choices for shopping, restaurants, entertainment.

title: Nice Weekend!
comment: We received an upgrade to a suite. Hotel is located central to everything. The staff was great as always! There was an outdoor concert on saturday night at the circle.

title: If you need to eat, don't stay at this hotel
comment: Clean comfortable rooms. Great front desk staff. The restaurant is very tiny and the service was none existent. Upon arriving, the host pointed to some tables and then walked away, never to be seen again. Finally we had to get up and walk over to the bar to order drinks. Never got as far as ordering any food as we never saw a menu or a waiter. They seemed to just want to all be behind the bar. BTW this was about 7p at night, dinner time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is overly willing to accomodate... All you have to do is ask.
title: The Epitome of Excellence!!
comment: Great Location, Friendly and Professional Staff, Phenomenal Amenities. You can't ask for better!

title: Extremely Loud
comment: Air conditioning made loud vibrating noises all night....I was on the platinum floor with smal children in rooms on both sides of me I could hear everything and the chiildren were extremely loud. Needless to say I did not get much slleep the two nights I was there.

title: AWESOME
comment: The hotel and the staff was awesome ( Ms. Opal and Mr. Aaron). Fabulous Stay!!!

title: Timely customer serivce for a left item
comment: I checked out of the hotel and a few day later, I realized that I left something. Upon calling the front desk associate explained to me how she would contact housekeeping for me and state what the left item was. The situation was handled nicely, but no word back as of yet on the left item.

title: loved the historic building
comment: We loved the ambiance and the history of the building. The staff recognized our BPG card status and gave us a nice upgrade. We enjoyed our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything in the Hotel was above my expetations. Thank you very much!
title: Ms.
comment: I like everything about this Hotel: the location, the people that work there, the rooms, the comfort of the beds, the view of the river, the food etc. etc...

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff and cleanliness. Sorry..I know. That's two things!
title: Very satisfied
comment: This hotel is very clean. The decor is tasteful and the beds clean and comfortable. We were on the Club Floor and liked the little amenities that were included. Staff members were friendly and always willing to help out. Parking was tight, but they have valet.

title: Nice hotel overall
comment: Staff quickly checked me in. Booked standard room, had a room on the 18th floor that faced the open space behind the hotel (you could see the train go by in the distance every so often).

everyoneShouldKnow: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend after my experience.
title: My first horrible stay at a hotel...
comment: I check in with my wife and think at first glance wow not too shabby.

everyoneShouldKnow: Spacious Room, great view...I had a great stay and I was very impressed with my hotel suite! Thank you!
title: I was very impressed with my room :) I loved it!
comment: I was impressed with the size of the room, I felt at home!

everyoneShouldKnow: It has an amazing staff!!..Everywhere you go, they will greet you with a smile!..also the Spa, pool, and the gym are excellent!!
title: Amazing Staff, Great Rooms and Beautiful Pool Area.
comment: My husband and I love to stay here for our weekend getaways. It has great amenities (pool, spa, gym, etc), amazing customer service and the rooms are very clean, nice, and spacious...all for a good price!... I tell everybody about this place..its good for young couples, singles/friends, as well as family/kids friendly. If you are in the San Diego Area/Carslbad this is the place to stay....and don't forget to visit the Spa!!!

title: Staff is fantastic
comment: Off the beaten path and a great place to stay

title: Positives and Negatives
comment: Belvoir Downtown Nashville is in a great location for Nashville Marathon and also easy walking distance to Broadway area/LP field. Rates were high for the weekend that we were there since it was Marathon weekend, which was fine, but the thing that bothered me the most was that they charge additional for almost everything like WiFi, rolling bed in room, additional adults and parking is not included either with hotel rate. I heard more than one person say "They get you coming and going don't they?".

everyoneShouldKnow: ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BILL AHEAD OF TIME!
title: CHECK OUT
comment: THIS HOTEL I STAYED FOUR YEARS IN A ROW. HOTEL ITSELF NOT BAD. BUT WHEN IT COMES TO CHECKING OUT EVERY YEAR THERE'S A PROBLEM FROM CHARGING MY CARD TWICE TO OVER CHARGING ME!

everyoneShouldKnow: Normally on point, but this time huge disappointment
title: lack of concern
comment: i requested microwave and fridge for my room prior to my arrival for $10 pr day for each. I arrived about 2:30 and checked in and no fridge or microwave. I requested and was told a few minutes. I requested several more times until a front-desk person hauled a fridge up around 8PM,and then said no microwaves available. I had purchased food at a restaurant for 2 day prior to arrival on a personal retreat. so that food sat unrefrigerated for about 7 hours. Needless to say it was not edible for the most part. no offer by hotel to make things right. in fact they charged $10 for that days rental and when I objected they they said they would waive the first days fridge rental. I have a handicap license plate and thru out the day if I left i had to circle the building several times to wait for someone to leave so I could park. On the last day i just parked under the canopy and informed the staff that I could not find a parking space, handicapped or otherwise. the manager on duty said that i would have to park at BEST BUY,next door, which is what he had to do, so he felt "my pain". I don't think this showed any consideration on his part, and his pain was not a concern of mine at the present time.

title: Excellent Customer Service!!!
comment: Most of all - the staff was exceptional in their customer service, from the front desk, to the concierge services, to maid service to the dining staff. Many were very quick to ask how they could assist you. We had a great stay. Room was much larger than most hotels, it was very comfortable. Convention areas were nice as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not, under any circumstances, try to stay at this hotel.
title: You forgot we were coming...
comment: A pre-paid reservation for two simple rooms with king beds should be no problem for a Grandbourne Hotel, right? Wrong. On arrival, we were told "there are no rooms". No apology, no upgrade, no voucher to move to the local Hilton.... After waiting an hour with no communication from staff, we were told the hotel was overbooked, as though it was our fault! Finally we were given two rooms with 2 doubles each (not what we reserved). Room 365 smelled of vomit - 271 was OK. I will never book a Grandbourne Hotel again - anywhere.

title: Bad weather
comment: During the weekend bad weather and Hail storms in St.Louis, we had booked the Belvoir City Center to go to the ball game the next day. Our cars windshields were totaled that weekend and the Belvoir employees, receptionist and managers were so very nice and helpful to make our stay in St. Louis extra nice. We were so glad to see that you had under cover parking for our car and could get a rental for the weekend.

title: Poor service
comment: BPG room was messy and poorly stocked. Ran out of newspapers for guests by 730 am. Poor service at desk and at restaurant.

title: Fantastic!!
comment: We stayed at the hotel in april. I can't say enough positive about this hotel and the staff! It was our first time to New York but unfortunaly our stay didn't turn out as expected as I had to go to the hospital for three days. The big guy in the Fitness (with a brooken arm) and the guy who helped me with massage I can't thank them enough for their help. And the manager (Kenny) who helped my wife and me when we had to stay in New York for two more days than we had planed was super! The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the heart of Manhattan. We stayed in the club floor which was fabulous! The club lounge was incredible. The room was clean and we had a great view down 7th Avenue. The beds are very comfy.

title: Excellent Stay
comment: Pro: Great Location, friendly staff, comfortable room.

everyoneShouldKnow: You don't need a car. Lots of choices for
title: Hotel close to everything
comment: We arrived early and we're pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. It was

title: Frequent visiter
comment: I frequently stay at this Belvoir mostly for business. The staff is very friendly and willing to make your stay more than enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle service to nearby train station is limited. Be prepared to race for a spot on the 8-seats shuttle.
title: Average stay, needs improvement
comment: An average hotel not in-line with the expected Grandbourne hotel experience. Hotel didn't acknowledge elite status upon arrival, did not offer the corresponding elite gift amenity. Had to ask for it the next day, asked for 250pts gift, instead my account was noted with "free paper" (which I did not request). Room was booked for 2 people but had only 1 bottle of water... Needed to have my key reprogrammed twice. Overall just an average stay, room was clean and comfortable, but little issues took away a lot from the experience.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: This hotel was beauitful and exceeded our expectations.

title: Great hotel experience
comment: We stayed two night and it was a very pleasant experience. We travel to NY often and this was one ofthe best hotels. Clean, comfortable, great location. Staff was very nice and accomodating.

title: This Hotel Has Great Staff!
comment: My husband recently stayed here for a work convention. The morning he left home we got a email from our credit card company that there had been fraud on his account. They had to suspend the card and of course that was the only card that my husband had with him. He had $40 in his pocket with no way to get any money out of the bank. I would have made the 1 1/2 hour trip to rescue him but our daughters Prom was that evening. I immediately called the hotel staff to try and come up with a solution. They were wonderful and very understanding. I filled out a credit authorization online and was able to pay for any expenses that my husband incurred. He didn't have to drive home and miss the second day of credits. They saved us! They are an amazing group of people...very professional, helpful and nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. My husband enjoyed his room and the facilities.

title: For work or play this is the stay
comment: Staff was great. Room were comfortable, nice bathroom/showere. Hotel lounge and view was a huge plus. Breakfast was good...afternoon nibbles kind be better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Expect to dine off site. There are not enough restaraunts on the site.
title: This facility can not handle multiple conventions.
comment: There were 3 conventions at the same time. There are 3 restaurants on site, one only had 1 of it's 2 rooms open and a one hour wait, the other upscale restaraunt closed at 9 p.m. Brilliant there was 400 people on site. After a long day of travel we had to eat at the bar. Not a good start. We came for breakfast the next day there was a 45 minute wait. We had to get something from the Starbucks stand. Great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location and ambience for conventions, seminars, shopping and dining.
title: Excellent location for shopping, dining & conventions
comment: Fantastic location with an excellent ambience. My only disappointments were that there was no coffee maker in the room when I checked in. It took 4 phone calls to get one an hour and a half later. The sink in the bathroom was extremely slow in draining - - badly in need of some 'draino' !! Bathroom is awfully small and I understand they are larger in another tower - - where is that? There were two used 'contact lens' on the floor when I arrived - and I don't wear contact lens - so they were not mine. So this means that the maid didn't vacuum the floor from the previous occupant. All-in-all - - my stay was excellent and I would stay again and highly recomment it to others.

title: Very Disappointing Service & Food
comment: I was really disappointed with the service and food quality of the hotel. I had to asked an extra bed 3 times even though it was requested on the reservation, by the time it was delivered it was almost mid-night. The food quality of the hotel is really bad I was hoping that I would be able to eat good food at the hotel since the food at the parks is so bad, unfortunately it was as bad as it is in the parks! One night we went to Il Mulino and it was better but when you consider the price is still very disappointing, we paid the same for the mediocre dinner than for the room! The same night we left our kids at the kid's club and the ladies were so rude with the kids, they need to have employees with a certain level of kids managing skills!

everyoneShouldKnow: Dependably friendly service in a great location.
title: Consistently good service in a very good location
comment: I have stayed in this hotel several times recently, and have been very pleased with the friendliess of the staff, especially at the front desk and in the club lounge. The fitness center provides exactly what I need, and tends to be uncrowded. The location of the hotel can't be beat, with easy access to the Gold Line and to shops and restaurants on Colorado Blvd. I look forward to my future stays here, and would highly recommend it, especially for business trips. Rooms are nice and clean, and I've had no probs with the A/C, etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect fantastic service just because you are supposed to be treated like a preferred guest.
title: Hotel Staff needs more training
comment: I stayed over a weekend to attend a convention. Got an email a few days before to upgrade my stay for $15 more per night for a room on the Club Level Floor and access to the Club lounge. Got there, got charged the extra $15 per night and got access to the Club lounge(eventually), but did not get a room on the Club Level Floor! The first day my card would not give me access to the Club Level floor or Club Lounge. Eventually on Saturday Morning, got new cards that actually worked correctly and was then able to get access to the Club Lounge. Club Lounge was as expected. Got free continental breakfasts and snacks were available throughout the day. Waffles for breakfast were soggy, I expected fresh, large Belgian Waffles, instead got soggy, soft microwave type waffles. Not pleased with overall experience of Hotel staff and treating me like a valued member of BPG or treating me well as a valued guest.

title: Spacious & clean rooms, but very tiny bathroom
comment: Upon check-in, we were warmly greeted and received our BPG gift. Check-in was very quick & efficient.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has first class service for all guest!
title: Expectations exceeded!
comment: Upon my arrival I was welcomed by the lobby staff and quickly checked into a room I didn't like. I wanted a view. Tressa, an angel, found me a wonderful room and made the change quickly with no problem. Then she checked to make sure I was happy later. Is this the Ritz? I couldn't believe it, but greatly appreciated the first class care and customer service.

title: Great stayed multiple times
comment: Room was clean and comfortable. Lounge is great and I like the 24 hr access. Staff is always friendly and accommodating.

title: Slightly Lacking
comment: Upon arrival, the tile in the sink area was sticky, we reported it and although they came to clean it, it remained sticky.

title: Convenient!
comment: Great for early morning flight but was VERY taken abake when told there would be a $20 fee for a small room refrigerator -- at the most expensive hotel in the area. That should not be the case.

title: Excellent
comment: My wife commented when we walked into the room that this was the best Belvoir that she has stayed in - we had an excellent experience at the Belvoir La Jolla. Very convenient to points north and south.

title: Great Hotel
comment: I really like this Hotel. Alex was really very helpful and kind. The only thing that would be better, if the hotel could pick up guests from the railway before 9AM if the guest called the hotel from the station, perhaps this could start at 7AM. Also at night pick up guests after 11:45PM, if the guest called.

title: Unsatisfactory stay
comment: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room i stayed in the first night was unsatisfactory. The aircondition seemed very dated and would not work very well and made lot of noise . The bed / matteress was no where near the quality of other Belvoirs i have stayed in. I requested for a room change and an upgrade to the Club level but could only get a room change for the second night. It seems that the regulars staying at this hotel know that the rooms at the Club level are far superior than the rest. i am certaintly not staying at this hotel in my future travels to Denver. The location was convenient to my office.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to major highways, dinning, and shopping.
title: Overall a great place to stay.
comment: I am in the area and booked it for three nights for simple no frills stay since I just need a bed for the four of us. The front desk book us in without much issues and I was placed on 6th floor for being BPG gold.

title: Lots to Like!! They Try Harder
comment: It is clear that this hotel was built to enjoy a capacity crowd attracted, in part, to the shopping center that is now no longer open. They have maintained the facility in the face of difficult surroundings and when I come to visit I always stay here. Why?

title: The facility is very nice & clean, BUT!
comment: My husband & I stayed at your hotel, while I was having day surgery at the Dr. Hospital. We are from Atl, and was required to stay in town for 3 days. When I booked the reservation, I was told $129 for first night & $151 for 2nd night and it was a breakfast & bed package. I did not get the B & B for Tues because I had surgery that morning and could not eat anything. On Tues during my surgery, my husband returned to the hotel to update our room key, because the gal told us in would expire at noon. While she was updating his key, she handed him a breakfast card with May 1st on it, so he then had pancakes before returning to the hosp. The next morning, we went down for our breakfast, and the waitress said that he had used up our free breakfast the day before, therefore we needed to pay for our 2 breakfasts. I didn't think much of it, thought it was just a little mess-up. I then reviewed our portfolio from both nights and was shocked to see several charges that were incorrect. At 11:30 when I approached the hotel desk, the woman was very rude and could not explain all our extra charges. She called the food manager, which seem odd to me because she didn't handle to charges. The two of them scambled for about 25 mins, looking at food receipts trying to prove that I was wrong. I have never had this type of unprofessional treatment at any up scaled hotel! When I left the hotel, they still didn't have it straightened out and assured me they would call or email me ASAP, as of today all I've recieved is the same bill from that morning. Another incident happended to my husband in our room, specially walking into the bathroom that have 2 small french doors W/ long metal door handles. He was trying to pour water out of the ice bucket, and ran his arm into the handle, and it is badly bruised. He was it pain, and he had to put ice on it to get the swelling down. Maybe you should look at that design, and make it more accessible.

title: Very nice layover
comment: We stayed here coming from the ariport, going to the crise and then came back fom the airport to go back to the cruise, the gust services staff on the early morning on the weekdays was very nice ppl, they even remembered me by name when i came back that was a very nice touch, made me feel like in home, i think the there names were Terry and Oscar very nice ppl like i seaid beore. also the bed was very confortable an the shuttle was always timely and clean

title: Overbooked
comment: We were at a convention and could not check in until after the night session was over. When we arrived to checkin the rooms that we requested were not availible, the reservation for the next night was not found and it took for ever to get checked in. This was all after calling the day before arrival and once again on the day of arrival. After checking out we were billed a "No Show" fee. Turns out the reservation associate spelled the names of one of our group so bad that they could not find it. Breakfast was way overpriced.

title: Below Grandbourne Standards
comment: Where do I begin?? I'll just make a list:

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is outstanding, but be prepared to wait a long time to check-in
title: Excellent Location!!!
comment: Excellent location, close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc. Subway stop just outside front door!

title: Belvoir Staff Failed to Execute on Many Fronts
comment: I booked a block of rooms for guests who were attending a wedding in the area in late April. Our discussions about our needs ultimately ended in a contract signed in November of last year along with a confirming e-mail clarifying some details. Guests of the wedding booked about 25 rooms over that weekend. Here are the problems we encountered:

title: Wonderful stay
comment: We spent 8 nights here and the staff was excellent. We received an upgradeand had access to the Club Lounge. Host & Hostess in the Club Lounge were super terrific and friendly. Front desk was very friendly and we enjoyed our conversations with Danny the Executive Chef. Hotel was very clean, room was nice. Tolay restaurant food was very good.

title: great location; not cleanliness I expect
comment: The location was very convenient, close to restaurants, in between a golf tournament in El Cajon, meetings downtown, and La Jolla; friendly service, great comfortable beds and workspace that I have grown accustomed to, BUT cleanliness was not where I expect: Fitness center - no cleaning wipes and no towels either day, despite discussing with them the first day (apparently brought towels after I left, but didn't correct problem for next day) table in bathroom that clearly had not been cleaned from last visitor, again, corrected when I complained.

title: Quick but perfect stay
comment: Overnight business trip - perfect location in the city, close to everything. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean and comfortable - breakfast was great.

title: Great Staff = Great Visit!
comment: It bears repeating. The staff is very helpful and friendly! I had a great visit. and would highly recommend the Belvoir Tribeca. People can make or break your stay somewhere and here they definitely make it! The location is convenient to subway stations, shopping, etc. Overall very good!

everyoneShouldKnow: Make reservations early just in case. People like to stay there.
title: Great Stay
comment: This was a return visit. Everyone offered exemplary service. The central location was perfect for where I needed to go and for my friends to visit. Great places to eat within walking distance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Closer to baseball stadium than you think.
title: In Need of Refreshing
comment: A very nice and serviceable hotel. Stayed here two nights for a work meeting. Hotel is in a decent location, close to hockey arena and a 5-10 minute walk from the baseball stadium.

title: It's time to renovate.
comment: Lobby looked nice, but rooms are old and outdated. This hotel needs some renovation.

title: Bad experience all the way around
comment: We were part of a large block of rooms for a wedding. We were guaranteed a rate that was supposed to cover additional days. I had to pay a higher rate for the extra day and when I asked to talk to a manager they said there isn't one here.They also made me check out and check back in on the day I had a different rate. Breakfast every day was a complete fiasco. They didn't have enough help, you couldn't get a cup of coffee without great effort, the breakfast buffet was often empty. The price was ridiculously high for the quality. Lastly, the front desk clerk was impatient and sullen. I will never stay here or recommend it to another. One nice thing was the shutttle it was very available and free.

title: Some improvements but....
comment: This review is for our stay on December 28, 2011.

title: Good value for the money
comment: Friendly staff.

title: First impression is very important!
comment: Dad and I alway stay at this hotel when we visit Chicago as part of our Christmas tradition. This review is for the day on Dec 26, 2011.

title: not bad
comment: Nice place.

title: Not recommend, tired hotel

title: Recent Upgrades has returned property to a prime airport location
comment: Amazing what $8 or 9 million can do! I have been staying at this location the night prior to my departure flight for the last 15+ years and had watched the property as it showed signs of aging. About two years ago I had to go through some discomforts during a lengthy renovation process. The staff has always been first class even during the frustration of renovations. The end product now makes it all worth while, from the brightness to newly furnished rooms, fitness facilities and re-opened lounge. The staff now seems even more cheerful if that is possible. Still a couple small faux pauxs like no extension phone in bedroom and lack of easily accessible electric outlets near work desk. I'm sure they will correct shortly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right on the beach. Very casual

comment: This is the second time we have stayed here. This time in April. Being right on the beach is a real plus. They do need enough beach chairs for all the guests, but the help at the beach were great. Our room with a balcony was nice, small but we knew that . The only downfall is the small coffee spot. Really needs to offer more in food and service. We would definitely stay here again

everyoneShouldKnow: The room was very clean and the food was great!
title: Thank you
comment: My stay at The Belvoir was excellent. The Customer Service and food was great. Upon check-in the staff treated me with respect and was very helpful. I was there overnight on business and dined at the restaurant which had great waitstaff and the food was delicious. I would highly recommend this hotel to my colleagues, Family, and friends if they're ever staying in the area. Thanks again.

title: The worst experience ever
comment: I stayed in this hotel for the half marathon event going on in columbus this weekend and from beginning to end my experience was beyond disaster. To start with I was told over the phone when I booked that I would have a room with a microwave and a fridge, that I would have free internet access, and that a late check out due to the marathon would be no problem. While arriving at the hotel, I was unaware of the parking situation in Columbus so I was a bit confused about what I needed to do. I had one staff member outside tell me while I was waiting behind several vehicles that valet parking was free for those staying for the marathon. At this point I had already been through 2 hours of hunting for parking places through surrounding garages and it was getting late. When the staff member got to me to take my car he told me it was a $30 charge, completely different than what I was just directed. Because I had already been waiting for so long and needed to make the marathon dinner, I was just going to pay it. He then told me i couldn't pay with a credit card and I would have to go get cash. At this point I was already ready to call the hotel and cancel my stay, but I didn't. I found a parking spot at the columbus commons parking area that a random person outside told me about. While checking in I was there was only one room option available regardless of what I was guaranteed over the phone, so I had no fridge or microwave for food options. By the time I got checked into the hotel it was later than the marathon dinner event they were holding. The phone in my room didn't work so every time I needed something I had to use my cell phone. I called a staff member who said he would bring me a menu and that he could have the kitchen make a pasta dish for me if I go down to the lounge. I went into the lounge and they told me they don't do special dishes and I have to order what is offered at those times on their menu. It was almost 1030 pm and I hadn't eaten dinner yet. I couldn't leave the hotel out of fear that I would run into loss of parking spots again because of the number of people in town for this event. From here I spoke to a lady at the front desk who gave me a catering menu of delivery options. I went back upstairs to my room and called and they were closed. It took everything to not call the manager and ask for my money back. I wasn't in marathon event mode anymore and was about to skip everything and drive back home. I spoke to another gentleman who gave me pizza places who will deliver. I tried to log onto my laptop to look at pizza menu when it asked me to pay for this service. So when i called the front desk she told me this service is only available to certain rooms. Once again I had been given false information from several different staff members. I called pizza hut and ordered something simple. The guy who delivered the order called me when he arrived to the hotel and told me that the people at the front desk were not letting him come up to the room. They even commented to me when I let them know how my night has been so far- that it isn't their fault I didnt make it in time for the runners dinner. But my wait for valet parking and the run around from employees outside had a huge part to deal with how late I was able to check in. I was beyond angry at this point. I'm a very patient person but I didn't know how much more I could handle from this hotel. I went to bed after eating with the hopes that the next day would be a new day. After the marathon event I came to my room and called the front desk just to confirm that I was okayed the late checkout. I didnt want to deal with interuptions while getting cleaned up after the race. The gentleman I spoke with was very rude to me and asked who I talked to because they never allow late check outs and I should be charged for this. I told him the lady who said this was ok and he said ok fine but we never do this just for future reference and hung up on me. While I was in the shower I had someone knock on my door several times. I'm assuming it was housekeeping and they weren't informed of my late checkout. So it wasn't just a fluke that the first night was horrible for me- the whole experience at this hotel was bad from beginning to end. The cost of this hotel is not cheap compared to others. To not have a complimentary breakfast, free internet service, and deal with all of the complications of food ordering, nonworking phone in the room, no fridge or microwave- this stay wasn't even close to worth what I paid. I'm leaving this lengthy review so everyone can see the details of what happened. All of the staff members at this hotel need to be on the same page because I was given a different story the whole time. Employees should know what food options are available for guests who aren't from around there and whether parking is free, and they should see what you were guaranteed on the phone while booking the hotel room. I will never ever stay here again. I will still be calling about this experience as well. I stay in hotels on a frequent basis and this was the worst experience I have ever had!!

comment: Having never been to New Orleans before, we were astonished to walk into our room, look out our window, and gaze upon the majesty of the Mississippi River below us. Our room was so nice that we almost did not want to leave it and go explore the city. Everything was wonderful.

Not sure if it was just during our stay but I would double check before entering.

comment: I travel a lot and stay at many different hotels all over the country and I would definitely rate this Hotel among the top 5%. Its a great place to stay, the stafff are absolutely fantastic, the rooms are confortable and the service is impeccable.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location, clean comfortable rooms, still affordable

comment: Our association hosted a conference at the Belvoir Gunter and the staff treated us very well. They were very accommodating and provided the best atmosphere for the conference. And the food was absolutely amazing.

comment: I was here for a business conference at the hotel. The hotel staff was very accommodating for our conference needs, setting up two buffet lunches outside of our conference room with just a few hours notice. The lounge and links business center are also nice. This hotel is a very short walk to the metro, providing easy access to downtown D.C. and it is also one stop away from Reagan Airport. When I plan a personal or business trip to D.C., again, I will definitely consider staying here.

comment: Overall not a bad hotel but not a great one either. The a/c didn't work very well, the roof leaked, and the lobby bathrooms were out of order. The roof in my room didn't leak but it did in the fitness center. Location was good for walking to shops, food, etc. Couldn't get a $0 balance receipt from the front desk to track expenses. No spa facility (hot tub, steam room, etc.). Took privacy sign off door at noon on first night but never got service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Totally relaxing as if you were in another remote location but 10 min from the city.
title: A Desert Oasis
comment: This hotel celebrates the spirit of the local Gila Indian community. The atmosphere is very relaxing and efficient. The history is even more fascinating. Canal cruise at sunset was delightful. Our room was outstanding! Ate at the Ko'Sin where local dishes enhanced our lunch.

everyoneShouldKnow: The accommodations are great and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The lobby has work stations with computers available for anyone to use.
title: Salt Lake City Belvoir
comment: The staff at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. They were very accommodating. The only issues I had were with the fact that the printer cartridge in the Club Lounge printer was never replaced despite the fact that I reported two days n a row that it needed to be replaced, and there were problems with the digital reception on my TV that different days that couldn't be corrected despite their best efforts. The front desk staff, bell staff, and maintenance people were very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away from the lobby restaurant. Venture out to eat. There are plenty of eating establishments within walking distance of the hotel.

comment: I was there for a pretty large conference. My company was sponsoring the event. The banquet staff & food was excellent. The meeting coordinators were great. I was very disappointed in the lobby restaurant however. On my departure morning I dined at breakfast time by myself. I was placed in the absolute very back corner of a large open space. It was actually funny seeing all the single people sitting around the outside edge of the dining room. My waiter was inattentive. I asked for something and never received it. He finally showed up after I had finished my meal. The lady sitting next to me requested some brown sugar for her oatmeal. Not a difficult request. The waiter (same one) just looked over toward the buffet and told her he did not see any. I was mad for her and told the waiter to go ask the chef for the brown sugar. It was amazing how unhelpful he was. They call this a service industry??

everyoneShouldKnow: It is an average hotel, complimentary breakfast is not a normal offer. They do however, serve starbucks coffee.

comment: Unfortunately this hotel needs tlc in the pool. The chlorine and chemicals were out of balance and my family and I all had a skin reaction from swimming in the pool. The only entrance to the pool under 4 feet deep is in doors. The tile around the pool is not wet rated and both of my children slipped and hit their heads. The hot tub was not any better. The curtains were also ripped in our room, and the tub is small, ugh. We will not return.

title: Horrible service!
comment: We stayed at this hotel as part of a block of wedding guests last week. The room seemed fine at first check but lacked basic toiletries that are always standard at Grandbourne Hotels (shower gel, toothpaste, q-tips). Our first negative experience was room service- we called at midnight after arriving to order off the very limited late nightdining menu. The menu has salad, sandwiches or cereal. We called to ask for cereal and were told that is not on the menu. when we informed room service that it is, they said "ok" but it will take 45 minutes! for cereal! we decided not to order it.

title: Superior Service, Lots of Amenities...
comment: ... great location, clean room, priced well. This hotel pulls it together just right. Until you experience the difference this outstanding, capable staff, can make on your busy, often hectic, trip, you might not understand why people rave about the service here. I highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Adjacent to Blackrock - there are many who try to come to the pool area who live locally or are from other hotels, the good news is that the hotel has instituted a wristband policy to keep all non guests out of the pool facilities and those of us who stay at the Belvoir Maui really appreciate this effort by the hotel - a big thank you to the hotel staff!

comment: The Belvoir Maui is simply the very best hotel you can stay at in Hawaii. The staff is friendly and attentive and the resort is immaculate! Our family has stayed at the Belvoir Maui every year for the last 20 years. It is truly a incredible experience to be on the best island in Hawaii at the best hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but not worth the money

comment: I spent 5 nights and attended a conf at this hotel. I was disappointed relative to other Belvoir's where I have stayed. My room was noisy - I could hear anyone in the hall way when I was trying to sleep. I had a package Fedex'ed to me, it arrived and was signed for by the hotel staff at 6:20 am, when I asked for the package no one had any record of receiving it and I did not get the package until 12:30 that afternoon. My lunch at the hotel restaurant was delicious - a bright spot. Upon checkout I found I was over-billed for something at the bar that I did not order ($46) and someone else in my group had numerous errors with her bill too. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Comfortable and Convenient

title: Great place to stay

I enjoyed the view at night as well. The city lights are so bright that they lit up the night sky.

My only complaint, which knocked my star rating down to 3/5, is that I asked for a 6am wakeup call and I didn't receive one. The front desk staff who checked me in wrote it down but I guess it didn't get processed. Luckily, I set my own alarm just in case but if I hadn't have done that I would have easily missed my flight in the morning.

comment: My check-in was great, the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. My disappointment is with the cleaning staff. After staying one night we left for the day then returned to our room to find that it had been partially cleaned, we ordered pizza the night before, the empty boxes were left in the room, empty coke bottles were left and our beds were made but halfway made, with no clean sheets. I feel that if I pay that much to stay in your rooms per night that all trash should be removed from the room and I should be able to sleep on clean sheets.

comment: The staff was very friendly and helpful and the grounds were very well maintain. However, the bed was horrible. Not only was it stiff and uncomfortable, there was no mattress pad and every time I rolled over the springs would squeak. The pillows were leaking the down filling and tiny feathers were everywhere which brought on an allergic reaction and I didn't sleep 2 nights in a row. The bed was HORRIBLE!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's easy to walk to City Walk if you take the Hilton elevator.

comment: It was overall a fgood stay. However, I wanted to work out. There was only 1 ellipitical machine and it was making loud noises. I got sick of warning everyone that came in. Not even a note was put on it. Also, of the 4 treadmills, 2 of them squeeked so bad no could use them without disturbing everyone else. But great location directly across from the train station & by the stadium. Hospitality was great also.

title: Customer Service sets this hotel apart
comment: The hotel offers a product similar to other Belvoir locations, but what truly sets this hotel apart was their customer service.

title: Great Hotel!
comment: The Belvoir Hotel & Towers is in a wonderful location! They have the most comfortable beds and courteous staff of any hotel I've stayed in while in NYC. I recommend them to everyone who travels there!

comment: Not what I expected for a newly renovated hotel. It's pretty obvious the lobby area was the focus for the improvements. This was my first stay at this hotel so I can't compare it to the pre-renovation status. The lobby is beautiful and I was told by a representative at the front desk the leather wall behind the check-in cost $20,000. I would have spent that money elsewhere.

everyoneShouldKnow: be prepared to pay extra fees for daily self parking and resort fees for use of property amenities. Hotel is very large and there is a lot of walking to access different areas of the hotel and parking.
title: Met most Expectations
comment: Chose this hotel for its proximity to the Epcot park. Standard room bathrooms are on the small side. Initially upon entry AC and room had a musty smell. AC system unit needs maintenance and cleanout. Door closing function needed maintenance. Door needed to be slammed each time so it would close. Silencers on unit doors would be nice so patrons don't have to continually listen to other unit doors being closed. Some of the bathroom lightbulbs were out in the vanity area making lighting very dim in the area. Furnishings are starting to show wear. Both the corridors and elevators had a very strange odor. Fitness center was a real plus with a good selection of equipment and very courteous and attentive staff. Pool facilities looked very nice but didn't have a chance to use. Overall nice hotel but very large and lots of walking to get around the facility.

title: Always an excellent stay!
comment: We stay at the Belvoir in Roanoke, Va about 3-4 times a year and ALWAYS have a wonderful experience! The rooms are clean and comfortable, the food and service are excellent and EVERY staff member is superb!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is fantastic and the rooms are great.
title: Home Away from Home
comment: It always feels like I am coming home when I arrive at the Belvoir. The front desk staff are excellent and greet you by name. I really don't know how they keep everyone straight but they always greet returning guests by name. Throughout the hotel, the staff always acknowledge you, no one is too busy checking their emails and text...a rarity of late.

everyoneShouldKnow: Access to the Club Lounge is a nice bonus.
title: Richard is outstanding.
comment: We really had a great experience at our stay last weekend. Richard at the front desk greeted us and he was very pleasant and genuine. As a BPG Platinum, he was very generous with an nice upgrade - one of the firsts I've had with this hotel. The room was fantastic, clean, and comfortable. Thank you for a great stay, we will be back - and thanks to Richard.

title: Below 4 to 5 star hotel standard
comment: - Front staffs are lack of service mindset.

everyoneShouldKnow: use valet parking if you have a car
title: BEST HOTEL FOR DHS
comment: The Dolphin is the best hotel to stay if your main park to visit is Hollywood Studios. Can't beat the boat. Also good for visits to Boardwalk and EPCOT, but a longer boat ride. Better food choices than the Disney hotels. We like the Beach Club better for going to EPCOT, but this was our first stay at the Dolphin and we were impressed. Be sure to use valet parking if you have a car.

everyoneShouldKnow: Breakfast is not included, somewhat confusing when looking at hotel description, but overall value for room very good.
title: Great Room for excellent price
comment: This was a quick overnight stay and the room value for a double suit with Sofa bed was great. Room was nice, bathroom could use some remodeling, but was clean. Staff was nice and attended to all needs. We did have an issue with breakfast where is was not clear if included or not and then they charged $18.00 each for buffet when my wife, daughter and mother-in-law had a bagel and coffee each. Bar was nice and interior hotel was very nice with transparent elevators. Pleasant stay

everyoneShouldKnow: The room was above average, very roomy and comfortable.
title: First stay
comment: This was the first time I have stayed at a sheriton Hotel and I am sold on them. Everything about the hotel the room the service everything was very very nice.

title: Sad to say
comment: The Belvoir has been my preferred place to stay when away from home, which is often, for many years. Unfortunately my last visit was highly disappointing. From the reservation forward. It was certainly out of charecter to my prior experinces, but has left a sour enough taste in my mouth and fear it will impact my future choices for lodging.

title: Great stay
comment: A very nice hotel, great bed, roomy bathroon, the only set back are teh work out facilities and teh pool. This hotel used to have hot tub but they removed it. The staff is great and location can't be beat

everyoneShouldKnow: good location, mini suites.. KC is really nice city with very nice people. I was pleasantly surprised...
title: Breakfast needs help
comment: Everything about the hotel was excellent except for the breakfast. It was a boring selection of mediocre food. Cold eggs, poor service, staff that would rather chat among themselves than work. I had a minor incident but it was resolved. Other than that, good hotel. Thessy at the front desk is tops !

title: Mostly great
comment: We stayed recently for a group trip. The group made an great choice on this property. We enjoyed the pool area the most. The staff were great (thanks Lo!) and the drinks were delicious!

title: Staff is beyond helpful and friendly
comment: The hotel is beautiful and I loved that the fitness facility was open 24/7. Upon entering through departure the entire staff is outgoing, friendly and unbelievably helpful. It was a most enjoyable trip made even better by the staff and amenities. Highly recommended.

everyoneShouldKnow: The people at this hotel are so accommodating and so personable it's unreal
title: 3rd stay here
comment: Our third stay at this hotel and we brought my sister in law along- we were able to be accommodated by having rooms across from each other, but the room location was not where I would have preferred. We pay extra for a room with a balcony and an Epcot fireworks view and this time that was a bit lacking. I did not enjoy the 4th floor in the central elevators side. I was honestly expecting at least the 6th or 7th floor to enjoy the fireworks from, and while you could still see them it wasn't the usual excellence that I've come to expect from this hotel.

title: Disappointing
comment: As a regular business traveller and BPG Gold member, this hotel was below expectations for a four night stay with my family. Early check-in request was moot as we arrived at four (after the "stated" check in time of three) and still had to wait for key release while they finished prepping the room. Beds sagged in the middle, pool was also the bar so smoky in the evening, and in general the decor and condition are no longer an BPG level 4 property. Location lets the operator charge for parking and a premium on the room that is not appropriate.

title: Watch your bill when you depart...
comment: I booked a room with BPG points. When my wife checked out she was charged a $55 fee. This fee indeed should not have been charged. I feel taken advantage of and still have not gotten my credit that hotel staff said I would receive after I called the next day.

title: Beautiful hotel, great staff!
comment: The hotel was beautiful, from the lobby to hallways, room, and lounge/restaurant. Staff was very professional, helpful and friendly (only exception was the rather snooty server in the restaurant). Loved the cozy bedroom section of the suite with its frosted pane French doors. Bathroom was very spacious, though if I'd designed it I would have skipped the tub, made the shower larger and put in a second sink (feel free to use these ideas for your next remodel). :-) Of course, the wonderful, comfortable Belvoir beds never disappoint.

title: Frustrating
comment: Major frustration in receiving clean wash cloths and hand towels. Housekeeping staff cleaning room NEVER left any wash cloths. The only way to get them was to call the front desk. I have always thought that when your room was cleaned you should automatically received clean linens for the bathroom.

everyoneShouldKnow: The employees make you feel at home and an honored guest!
title: Nice hotel at a great location
comment: The hotel is centrally located in San Antonio, near the the Alamo and the river walk. What makes this hotel great to visit are the employees who know how to make you feel comfortable as guest. We will return!

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly, Knowledgeable Staff and Great Location.
title: Home Away From Home
comment: Gorgeous Hotel and Great Location.... The Staff Was Friendly and Knowledgeable, and The Belvoir Princess Kaiulani Offers Cultural Demonstrations, Allowing Guests The Oppurtuntiy to Get a Tatse of The Real Hawaii. The Rooms are Very Clean and Comfortable. Everything About The Hotel and The Staff is Outstanding.

title: Hotel clean and comfortable
comment: I have one complaint. I am a Gold BPG member. In my previous travels, I was upgraded to club level, when available. This hotel refused to do so, claiming it was free for Platinum members only. Also, breakfast is free till 9:00 am. We came down at 9:25 and were charged $5.00 for 2 pieces of fruit we ate.

title: Good place to stay for conference
comment: I stayed here while attending a conference and the location was fantastic, right across the street from the convention center. The workout facilities were amazing and the coffee shop in the lobby was open very early, which worked out well for me. I liked the option to skip maid service for a $5 food and drink voucher.

title: Very nice hotel, overpriced
comment: This is a very nice facility but is simply overpriced. We supposedly received a corporate group rate, yet I could book it for $4 cheaper at Travelocity. The site keeps mentioning a lowest price guarantee but our group rate (Fortune 100 company) didn't even achieve that. Also, I was booked with a room with double beds per our group rate when the Travelocity booking showed King's still available (for less) and others from our company were offered a King later at a much higher rate yet. I was told I could get a king or queen if it became available but of course that just means if they were unsuccessful at booking the higher rate, aka 'no'. And of course another $10/day for wireless internet even though that's free at a hotel that costs $60. Beautiful facility, nice rooms, but simply overpriced.

title: Meet the needs of our leisure travel
comment: The hotel was in a great location as a hub for visiting Utah. Friendly staff and clean hotel.

title: Recent Stay in St. Louis Belvoir
comment: This hotel needs some major renovations. Hopefully this is in the budget. The rooms were clean but furniture was very outdated. Shower had mold in it.

everyoneShouldKnow: The concierge team are very knowledgeable
title: Needs updating
comment: Having stayed here for the past 5 years for each NRA show, the hotel, this year was a big disappointment. The bedroom on my floor (9) was looking tired in need of some re painting and decorating. There needs to be improved housekeeping - previous guest hairs in the bath are not appealing, and basic restocking of supplies, ( no stir sticks for 5 days) In house manitenance needs to be more responsive. On a positive note Michael the doorman however is always pleasant,consistent and an assett to the hotel.

title: Not my favourite Grandbourne Experience
comment: Not a great experience; went to my room, it was not a king, but two doubles, had to change rooms. Gold Member, didn't get an BPG floor; got an unsolicited wake up call at 6AM; took the BPG points for one of the two rooms I had; free internet for the other. The internet was horrible, wasn't even worth taking it, I gave up after trying to work for an hour. Told the front desk, there was no effort to credit my account with any BPG points, and in fact, they didn't even credit my account for the points on the room I didn't take the internet. I will not return to this hotel.

title: Tired and Worn
comment: This hotel is in serious need of updating and a deep cleaning. My carpet was filthy and stained- I kept my shoes on the entire time. I retrieved the blow dryer from the bag, it was sticky and covered in hair, etc. it was very obvious something was spilled on it. The prices for a soda out of their machines is ridiculous $3.00 for a bottle of coke- I literally walked to Station Square kiosk and purchased one for $1.50!

title: Good Property, GREAT STAFF
comment: Stayed here on business this week. This property was very centrally located and had everything I needed.

title: Disappointment
comment: Old, Tired and Smelly

everyoneShouldKnow: I would not recommend the accessible rooms here.
title: "Accessible" rooms have problems
comment: When I booked, I requested the "quietest room possible" as it was very important that my child get a good night's sleep as she was in town for an important event. In fact, I had chosen a Belvoir because in my experience their beds really are the best, guaranteeing us a comfortable night.

guestFrom: San Pedro, Los Angeles, CA, USA
title: Average Hotel; No BPG Recognition
comment: Spent one night here. Check in was fast but no mention of Grandbourne Platinum status, other than when the desk clerk handed me the Platinum key card envelop, saying "I guess you want the 500 points?".

title: Great Return Stay
comment: This was our 4th stay.....and as always, it fit our needs perfectly. Good location, comfortable beds, clean and lovely rooms, and GREAT staff. The friendliness and helpfulness of every person working there makes it a pleasure to stay at this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: It underperforms its potential, but the location is terrific...
title: Needs to cater to BPG members better....
comment: This hotel has been in renovation mode for several years and is mostly a revolving door of personnel. Three valet companies in two years; new front desk staff constantly. Most rooms are connectors and, therefore, noisy. They cater to a European travel crowd and don't pay nearly the attention to the domestic customers. The room selection for BPG elite members is very poor and the front desk does not appear to care. On the good side, if you need anything, Hugo at the concierge desk isone of the best things about the hotel. This hotel could be great, but is merely mediocre currently....

title: Great service
comment: We had such a wonderful experience at this hotel, we are coming back in June! The shuttle is easy and picks up right out front. The club level is the way to go. Great and helpful staff made our stay even better!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, view & easy access to downtown area.
title: This hotel exceeded my expectations
comment: I viewed several hotels in the San diego area, but this one met my needs. It had a great view of the bay & my wife also complimented me on the location as well as the view. The staff @ check-in made it very easy & fast. I will put this hotel in my phone as a future reference. Good place to lay your head & enjoy the view.

title: Stayed twice and love this hotel
comment: Great location outside Atlanta.Suites are excellent for families.Excellent service. At Breakfast, Andy the Sous Chef and the wait staff stayed longer to make our meal delicious and pleasureable. The lady who checked us in at 2 in the morning had a great sense of humor, welcoming us and making us laugh.

title: Very disappointed
comment: It wasn't all bad, the staff and customer service were top notch, when there were issues, they answered questions and took care of any question, very please with staff. But it's sad to say that is were it ended. Many issues some were small but still. There was a room mix up (we had 2 rooms) one of the rooms was actually a different family members and they inadvertently given it to us, what a surprise when they walk in and found us there. The only good thing was that it was another family member and not a stranger. The rooms smelled, and we found out why in one, a baby's diaper was hidden in the sofa bed, shame on the person who missed finding it but a bigger "shame on you" to the one who put it there. Chairs, comforters and floors were stained; floors needed vacuumed also. No Kleenex's in the box by the sinks. Remote in bedroom didn't work. The internet/WiFi was not what expected. If you don't have a Nintendo you may have trouble getting it hooked up, no directions. Room were spacious, but the furniture was just worn out, including the carpeting. One of the chairs was torn on the arm.

title: Worst stay at a Belvoir
comment: I stayed here for a conference and as a Grandbourne member expected this Belvoir to be similar to others I had stayed at and of good quality. The person checking me in was rude, answering the phone during the check-in and when I asked him to give me two room keys he said, "I can do this thing called multitasking, I heard you when you asked". The room I received had trash all over and was clearly not cleaned, and was a room with 2 double beds instead of 1 king as I had requested. The manager moved me to a room with a king bed after I complained and after I was hung up on initially by the hotel staff member answering the phone. The concierge was also very rude, stating at one point, "I have the same information you do, so what do you expect me to help with?" The shower did not drain and would fill with water during a 15 minute shower, but I gave up after letting housekeeping know about it twice. I would recommend to stay away from this hotel and have never been more dissatisfied with a hotel stay in my life and never more grateful to make it home.

title: My favorite Belvoir Hotel in US
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times for business. Stayed at Belvoir hotels >75 nights last year and this is absolutely my favorite in the US. The staff is awesome starting with Naz in the Club Lounge, Sandra and Sandra, Veronica at the front desk, Leticia in the restaurant, as well as all the staff. The staff remains the same which has something to say about managment and making employees satisfied. For business travelers, the hotel makes you feel comfortable, the next best thing to being at home. Love this hotel and the employees.

title: Disappointed
comment: Booked a club room but disappointed that you had to pay for wine or beer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to downtown, Old Town, Little Italy and obviously the airport! Great location!
title: Better Than Expected!
comment: I had mixed feelings about staying here (based on some reviews I had seen), but I would definitely recommend it now! One thing that stood out was the service! We had a couple issues (A/C and incorrect billing), but both were resolved quickly, professionally and with a smile!

title: Exceeded my expectations
comment: When I arrived, I was expecting one room with two beds and a bathroom. The room originally assigned to me was not ready so the front desk representative upgraded me to a king with a bathroom suite that included a separate shower, jacuzzi tub, sink area, and water closet (oh it was luxurious - I took a jacuzzi bath every night). I was checked in immediately without hassle or argument. The view was nice, the room was quiet, and I was able to work in peace. The hotel is close to many restaurants and the area is safe - I walked alone at 2 in the morning though I didn't go far. My only complaint is that the hotel is HUGE. You do not have to leave the hotel to get what you need but you might get a bit turned around. The staff was amazingly responsive and the food at the hotel restaurant was excellent and didn't upset my delicate stomach (a major plus because that means the ingredients are of good quality). When I realized that I had only an 1 hour and 1/2 to get my flight, the bell staff was on the move and I was in a cab in moments. I didn't make the flight, but that was the airport (which I could complain about endlessly), not the Belvoir. I would stay there again even braving the airport for the opportunity.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great restaurant on site called Yard House and awesome fitness center
title: Housekeeping needs improvement
comment: Overall great hotel. Good location as well. The only thing that really tarnished the experience was housekeeping. Though the room was cleaned sufficiently, other things were really inconsistent e.g. not getting water everyday (very dry climate), once getting ready to take a shower and no wash clothes, one coffee cup instead of two. Good service is being consistent and meeting customer cutomer expectations. I stayed their 8 nights. Also, I rented a refrigerator and the first one wasn't working and by morning all my food was warm. That was irritating. Finally, it was disappointing to discover there was a rental fee for the refrigerator ($10/day) and fees for internet when most smaller and cheaper hotel chains provide these amenties free.

everyoneShouldKnow: $10 parking fee a day and $12.95 fee wi-fi internet a day.
title: Fees for parking and internet
comment: $10 fee a day for parking!!!!! thats unacceptable and another $12.95 for wi-fi internet a day. I will never comeback to this hotel.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Outstanding staff! Great Location! Very Accomodating! Thanks Belvoir!

title: Poor response to room issue
comment: Nice hotel with clean room. Very poor staff response to bedroom tv issue in room 623. Digital channels did not work. Was told once reported that someone would be right up. 90 minutes later went down and told them to forget it - I was going to bed.

title: Bar staff is awesome!
comment: If you are staying at this hotel you have to go to the bar. The staff is incredible, polite, friendly and fun.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent lobby and pool area. This is five stars
title: Awesome lobby and pool area
comment: Most of the staff are awesome but a few are cold. The room fixtures are somewhat outdated and water takes sometime to warm up; however, it is clean and somewhat comfortable. The internet is awful and this has made my chance of staying here again unlikely. The elevator is old and will close in on you. The lobby and pool area are five stars. The breakfast is awesome. The driveup to hotel entrance require some improvements because you can get blocked in for several minutes.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very helpful and location is great!
title: Awesome!
comment: I had an incredible weekend at this property! Stephanie was very helpful and accomodating at check-in and the bar staff/manager ( mark & 'dega' as we appropriately nick-named her) were great as well! Great hotel in a great city!

title: bad experience
comment: i stayed in this hotel because i had a doctor appointment in morristown when i got to my room i found that a ceiling tile had collapsed and there was water leaking which took about an hour and a half to be fixed during which i was confined to my room waiting for the staff to correct it than i went down to complain at the desk all they did was move me to another room on the club level as soon as we walked in my wife complaind about a nasty smell which i traced to the bathroom when i called down about this they told me the only room avail is an handicap room on the first floor so i requested a king bed when i got to he room there was two full beds when i went to the desk they gave me another handicap room supposedly king but also full all in all i went through 5 rooms and by the time i got to sleep it was midnight even though i checked in at around 930 and had to wake up at five a bad experience

everyoneShouldKnow: Two things 1)Don't expect to be able to use the internet (it is as bad or worse than dialup), 2)if you book a club level room call and confirm you will get one.
title: Didn't get the type of room I booked
comment: I'll start by saying the hotel lobby and staff were nice. But the positives end there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Super friendly staff that make you feel welcome
title: Island of calm in a storm
comment: When you have to just rest and get away from the craziness of airports, delays, travel nightmares...the Belvoir Gateway LAX is the gateway to rest. The staff is super friendly and I found them bending over backward to make sure I was comfortable and had all my needs met. I was exhausted, beat and feeling low but this place was a sanctuary for me from the tempest that raged outside. All I needed was a quick respite and this hotel was more than accomodating to that need. I will remember this sunny island next time I fly by, most certainly.

title: Had a great time!
comment: Upon arrival I was very pleased with the service and attention that greeted us. The hotel was spotless and the doormen were always helpful. Our best experience was the dinner that the chef prepared for us the evening after bringing back fresh fish from our fishing trip. It was the best meal we had all week in Florida. The room however was a little disappointing. The first thing we noticed was how paper-thin the walls were. (or it could have just been the connector door). Obviously there was a small child (<1) next door who didn't like to go to sleep. We should have insisted on another room.

title: Great location
comment: Great location to 16Street Mall and Convention Center.

everyoneShouldKnow: MAke sure they put you in the MArina Tower.
title: Overrated and Overpriced
comment: This hotel was far below my expectations, andwell beneath what it should be to justify the room rate.

title: great hotel
comment: I enjoyed my whole stay at this property with my wife , front desk is great . Room is very clean .The food at the 1900 Bar and grill is excellent as well as the service , friendly staff , the restaurant manager is very kind.. Very convenient hotel only few minutes from the airport.

title: Great business hotel
comment: I want to give credit to the staff of the hotel, who do a wonderful job in meeting, greeting and taking care of the customers. The level of service was impressive.

everyoneShouldKnow: You get what you pay for.
title: Would avoid, if possible
comment: Breakfast buffet was bad (horrible tasting sausage links). More disappointing was the unresponsive service. Never asked how everything was, rarely offered to refill my coffee and water until I asked. And they had zero personality (though not a surprise from foreign bred workers).

title: Location
comment: Best things: Location, Bell Captain at end of trip.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right on the 16th street shuttle line.
title: Center city hotel that keeps itself young
comment: Folks on lodging side of the house did their thing as management would hope. Welcome, room cleanliness were excellent. Ice was difficult to find from 19th floor in tower. Service for breakfast was slow even in uncrowded atmosphere.

title: Great City, OK hotel
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Chicago during the restaurant show so they were sold out and as a result I ended up in an "ADA equipped room" but unfortunately there was no where to out your shaving kit etc. The Internet was very slow and the desk chair was broken. They replaced it with an older wooden chair with a nail poking thru the seat cushion. The arm chair had a layer of visible dust. The staff were generally pleasant and the location of the hotel was great. The room decor was fairly up to date. So overall, loved the city, and the Belvoir was OK. Would conditionally recommend to friends.

title: Not a great overall experience
comment: The reservation process required two reservations because I could only redeem my Grandbourne points for specific nights. I could not make my reservations online, the reservation process was confusing for your operator and complicated the check-in process. I'm disappointed that I can not redeem my points on the days that I need to travel. I decided to checkout one night early but I was still charged for that night even though I gave 2 days notice because I had a special rate - a whopping $10 cheaper than your regular rate.

title: Decent airport hotel
comment: Average hotel near to the airport. Convenient with frequent shuttle service to/from the airport. Food and service in the hotel's restaurant was really good.

everyoneShouldKnow: That everyone was very helpful!!! The Chef made sure his staff was in order!! The attendants was so on point. If you need to do a venue this is the place you would want to do it!!!!!
title: Bridal Shower
comment: I just cant express enough gratitude that I have for what the Belvoir done for us on 4/28/12!!! Our event was amazing and the hospitality was impeccable!! From the d飯r to the layout of the entire venue was jaw dropping. The staff went above and beyond to make sure everything was to our likings and expectation. If I needed something they were there to fulfill it. Kudos to Ms. Fiona (An Angel in Disquise) who walked us through the process from beginning to end from the contract to the menu to it all!!! She was even readily available for us on the day of the event which was a Saturday!! If she had to step away the General Manager Step in and hats off to Mr. Lucas as well!! This is one great team at this new lovely location of the Belvoir on Wilmington 95 South. I couldnt have asked for a better staff to have been available to make this once in a lifetime event to go down the way it did. Might I add the food was AMAZING!! I have not one complaint!!!
