I pray this Belvoir will stay on the charts for a long time coming!! Any other event I need to do will be sure to be done right at this location!!!!!

title: Renovated rooms nice but--less niceties
comment: I have been staying at this hotel for several years and the renovations provided some welcome updates to carpeting, etc. In addition the staff is very professional and always helpful. However, not all changes are good. The bathroom lighting is very dim and there are no towel racks or hooks of any kind! It's very frustrating that I have to pile my "hanging" toiletry bag next to the sink where my wash clothes and hand towels also pile up. Where is a guest expected to place their items?

title: Excellent Broadband
comment: Wi-Fi signal and 50+ Mbps bandwidth were excellent during my stay at the Belvoir Dallas Hotel by the Galleria.

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located in the heart of downtown. Bricktown, Botanical gardens, etc. very clean and safe.
title: Workout Facility is great!
comment: I was very impressed by the workout facilitiies and the equipment available.

title: Nice hotel, but broken tv,unattentive staff
comment: I was extremely disappointed not to be able to watch a movie in my room. By the time I finished waiting for an engineer to fix the tv, it was late. The engineer was unable to fix the tv and it was too late to change rooms and begin a movie. I felt that I wasted my night dealing with the tv!

title: The good and bad
comment: The hotel offers the best location for those going on a cruise. However there are many shortfalls. Poor housekeeping, Poor onsight food service and poor front desk relationship representatives.

everyoneShouldKnow: The shuttle drivers are a riot!
title: This hotel is convienently located
comment: Normaly this hotel is top notch, sadly on this visit it was a mess. Our room at check in looked as though a fight had occurred in the room. The bathroom door had been kicked in and no longer closed. The drapery had what appeared to be blood all over one panel. Can't believe that housekeeping signed off on this room to be rented in that state. Top it all off, the key reader on our door died. Fortunately, there was a nice guy from maintenence who fixed all of this stuff by the next day.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is an enormous hotel with multiple towers and banks of elevators that service specific floors. Pay attention to signs to help navigate.
title: Information - 911
comment: I loved the location of the Dallas Belvoir, it was super easy to leave the rental car parked and use the train, which was accessible right outside the Hotel. Parking was confusing. I didn't find information through my business travel reservation system, or in the room literature. It was learn as you go. The staff was very nice and pleasantly answered any questions. You should expect to pay approx. $20 - $30/day additional to your room rate for parking. Information in the room about the hotel amenities was slightly out of date, and there were no maps of downtown in the room. The TV interface provides some internet, but there was no keyboard to use this option. The room is set up for your own computer, which is a plus. Finally, something as simple as contacting guest services was unnecessarily complicated - the room literature indicated to dial 0, one phone indicated dial 61 and a second phone had a short cut button to call. Only the second phone short cut button worked, dialing 0 or dialing 61 resulted in ringing - but no answer. Of course, once contact was made, the service was great. The room is up to date - but the user interfaces aren't :0).

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for a Sesame Place vacation!
title: Mother's Day
comment: Thanks to Mike at the front desk for getting us our 2 connecting rooms - great Mother's Day!

title: old and acts that way
comment: The high point was the desk staff after that it went downhill. Not sure why I was given a handicapped room, I never asked for one and the hotel certainly wasn't at capacity. Right near elevator, smell to room. Too few outlets, had to unplug devices to use computer and charge cell phone. I truly could not understand a word the waiter/bartender was saying when I ate at the restaurant. $14.00 per day for parking...REALLY!!! The lot was overgrown with weeds, if I were you I'd be thankful someone was staying there. Lobby was nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good service, loud fan in rooms
title: Hotel was good
comment: The room and bed were great, but the bathroom was very small and there were no towel rack - very odd. The lighting in the bathroom was not very good for putting my make up on. The fan in the room was extremely loud and I had to turn the TV up to hear it. It also woke me up a couple of times.

title: Great location!
comment: The Belvoir is a beautiful hotel! We stayed during the Crafwish Boil so the location was perfect. The only complaint I have is that when we arrived there was a used towel hanging up over the shower. It was stiff and dry so obviously it had been there. It was a disappointment because I was so satisfied with everything else.

title: A good hotel destined to be great.
comment: I stayed at the Delfina May 6th to 8th, 2012.

title: Lets Do It Again!
comment: The rooms were spacious, clean, and had a nice view. I have lodged here since 2003 and have had a great time each visit!

title: A True Home Away from Home!
comment: I have spent the past 6 weeks here on business, and am scheduled for many more in the future. I must say that this hotel has made being away from home an easier endeavor. The staff is always helpful and friendly, always with a smile on their face. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. This hotel is newer and puts any of the other local hotels to shame. Be sure to check out the spacious gym and the great bar... great drinks and delicious food!

title: Decent comfort but marred by bad accounting
comment: My family and I stayed one night at the Belvoir Burlington. The hotel is

everyoneShouldKnow: Unless you really love valet parking, my only recommendation is to use the public parking garage immediately across Houston for $9/day and save yourself some cash. The valets are great but I would rather use the $30/day next door at Bohanan's!
title: Great Hotel in San Antone
comment: I stayed at the Gunter for the first time last week. Outstanding hotel in an outstanding location next to the River Walk. All of the hotel staff were excellent from check-in to check-out. My room was superb - roomy and comfortable. Excellent access to computers both in the Club and in the lobby. The Gunter is a classic hotel from another era that truly stands out in downtown San Antonio!

title: This hotel is in a Great Location and had Great Service.
comment: I am from the Bahamas, and travel to Fort Lauderdale quite frequently. I love staying at this hotel but I must add that I always stay at the Sherarton when travelling. The Service here is remarkable, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The only downside is the bathrooms really need to be cleaned thoroughly because there was mold visible in the shower and clearly in the back of the sink (which can be seen in the mirror). It was an overnight trip so no need to change rooms, but Ive noticed for the last few trips that the bathrooms have mold, and it really grosses me out so that is something the hotel can work on. The couches can also use some replacing. I think because of the bathrooms I just may stay somewhere else but if this issue can be resolved I would definitely continue to stay here.

title: convenient hotel
comment: The hotel has a great location , friendly staff , good food and serervice . The bar is very amusing with the tv around , the Bartender Soka very proffessional , the restaurant manager Mike is very nice and friendly. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and i will be back and recommand it to all my friends who will be visiting Atlanta.

everyoneShouldKnow: Call to confirm the room that you book.
title: Disappointed!!!!
comment: I booked a room this past weekend for mothers day, I specifically wanted the suite. I looked on he website, looked at the traditional rooms compared to the suites and I choose the suite. When we got to the hotel I was given a traditional room, when I went back downstairs the attendant asked me if I had the reservation number. While I was looking for it the person came over and told me that there was no way I could have booked a suite for the amount that I paid and I must of look at the wrong picture when I was booking the room. I was totally offended. I travel from manhattan for nothing, I definitely did not enjoy my stay.. Very disappointed, I only stay because I was too tired to drive back to the city. If I wanted a traditional room I could have stayed in the city I took the ride because I like the way the hotel looked and because of the suites. Never again...

title: There for a conference
comment: Everyone complained about the freezing conference rooms, bar and resturants; very little response or fixing. The Gift Shop was out of this world expensive and they acted like they were doing you a favor. Fitness Center was one of the best I've seen though and the room was ok, but nothing noteworthy.

title: Just like new
comment: When I first saw the hotel, the outside is looking old. But once I stepped in WOW. Its beautiful. The staff was great, the pools were big and clean. Love the outside restaurant by the pool. Its also a great location, very close to the outlet malls and Disney and a short drive to Universal.

everyoneShouldKnow: Charges to leave baggage, even for just a few minutes.
title: Comfortable room but ridiculous left luggage policy
comment: While my room was very comfortable, my overall experience was tainted by the hotel's policy to charge $3.50 per piece of left luggage even if the luggage is being left for an hour or two. I have travelled all over the world and have never seen a hotel charge for luggage left by a guest checking out. What was particularly frustrating was that I had checked out at 8am, planned to attend to a couple of appointments including a breakfast meeting and then pick up my luggage (one small suitcase) before heading to my next appointment at 10am. Had I realized there would be a charge for leaving my suitcase, I would have simply not checked out and would have kept the luggage in my room until I returned at 10am (still before the required 12pm check-out time).

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient to airport and car rental.
title: Need more customer service
comment: Hotel was on the whole, excellent, especially in Albuquerque. Very convenient and clean. My only frustration was: I ordered breakfast, having placed the sign on my door for a 6:30am delivery. The food never arrived. I called to complain and make sure I was not charged. The staff didn't offer to expedite an order - so I left the hotel to eat.

title: Fantastic Hotel
comment: I have to say that our room - overlooking peaceful woods with a balcony - was one of the nicest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. What a very pleasant surprise!

title: All Things Good
comment: Great bellman & check-in/check-out help; friendly bellhop & limo service& directions, Truly great food, reasonable restaurant prices (especially the $9 for anything on the lunch menu). Loved saving $5 each night for coupons useable for the restaurant (esp as We generally go green & do wish for fresh towels nor room make-up anyhow).

title: This hotel has a poorly trained front desk staff
comment: No clerk at desk when I arrived

guestFrom: Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles, CA, USA
title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: Good location. Friendly staff. Rooms are very nice.

title: 2nd stay went well I think except for wifi
comment: Got a clean room on the 6th floor. On the second stay in less than 2 weeks, I'm simply looking for a clean room and a good bed to sleep in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right in the center of town.
title: Good Midtown Choice
comment: I chose to stay at the Belvoir New York because of its proximity to the Museum of Modern Art and its short walk south to the Theatre District. I lived in New York City for ten years, and while there are other more interesting, less commercial neighborhoods to choose from, this hotel is a great strategic center from which to venture in any direction.

title: Club Lounge Rate but not amenities
comment: Had booked this with club lounge rate - had to specifically request access to club lounge (was not recognized at check-in), and other amenities that reportedly came with room were not actually provided.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs an update to remain competitive against other hotels in area.
title: Update needed badly
comment: This hotel appears very nice from the outside and even in the first floor lobby. However once you exit the elevator to the floor where your room will be located, it becomes obvious that this hotel needs to be updated. The hallways have a distinct smell to them, which I can only decribe as "old". The decorations followed in the same theme as the smell. Once inside the room things improved but not by much. The beds were comfortable and the temperature was easily controlled. That covers the positives. The bathroom was small with a no frills shower/tub and a toilet that appeared to have been removed from an airplane. The drains in both the tub and sink barely worked. At one point I thought I must have accidentaly closed the drain . The windows would have had a decent view if they were not cloudy from lack of washing. The TV was old and below what you would expect from a nice hotel. The customer service at the front desk was nice but subsequent responses including one to fix the "airplane" toilet were delayed. The valet is basically mandatory at a fairly steep price. Overall my wife was not happy with our stay which thankfully was only for one night. I will book elsewhere in future trips.

title: Great hotel
comment: Only thing is kind of nothing around, but Wilmington is drivable.

title: Hershey Trip
comment: Stayed on the club floor, great chocolate cake! Kids loved the pool and it's close to everything. The breakfast buffet was a good value especially with children.

title: Good except
comment: Everything was good except there was no hot water in my room when I took a shower on arrival. In the morning it was fine.

title: Needs Improvment
comment: I have stayed twice now at this hotel. The first time was great no issues at all. The second stay could have been a lot better. Housekeeping really dropped the ball. I had a few other small issues that would have not been a big deal if the hotel would have taken the time to address the issues and fix them instead of just passing the buck from one person to the next.

title: Great stay
comment: This hotel is A+++Greaaat

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a long elevator wait, because the elevators do not meet guest capacity.
title: This hotel does not utilize its full potential
comment: The hotel becomes over-priced after they charge you for parking space and in-room internet service. I also expected better inside-pool conditions. The ambiance of the pool is gloomy, and dirty. Water was extremely cold, and also very dirty.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't leave anything at the front desk for someone to pick up and bring your own bedding.
title: Not what I expected
comment: The check-in process was great, very courteous and helpful. However once I got to my room I was very disappointed. I would never have expected all the scary stains I saw in that room! From what looked like rust marks on the pillow cases, to black mold-like stains on the bedding (as well as hair that was not mine), and stains on the carpet and curtains, it was gross! It felt like the whole room and everything in it needed a proper wipe down and certainly the bedding needed a bleaching.

title: Remodel is so needed
comment: I have stayed here multiple times and every time, it seems there are multiple issues. club room coffee maker not working, to the keys not working, etc.

title: Great Staff, Needs updates to rooms
comment: Everyone I met at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. However, this hotel is definitely dated (although still clean). The location is great - right in the center of Indianapolis. The staff was even kind enough to upgrade our room. I definitely appreciated it. The lady who checked us in was friendly and welcoming. When we went to our room, the hallways were dark with exposed wiring where lights used to be. I'm assuming these were being switched out? The wallpaper was peeling away from the wall and the lamp had a high pitch squeal when plugged in. The TV stations were kind of spotty. The light over the bathroom sink only had two of the three bulbs working.

title: Nicely Renovated and Very Convenient
comment: Have stayed here many times since we always arrive at Bradle on a late flight and appreciate the location within the airport. Recently updated, accommodating staff , decent restaurant and Club Floor lounge

title: Close to Everything
comment: Great place to stay. Close to most of all the main attractions that you would ever need. We felt pretty safe also walking around in the evening also. We stayed in the refurbushed area of the Hotel which was very nice.

title: Outstanding Guest Service
comment: My stay at the Belvoir Downtown was greatly enhanced by your excellent staff. From day one, they have been welcoming, and extremely accomodating. I had the pleasure of staying at the hotel for 18 days and they made the hotel feel like a home away from home. As the Departments I came into contact with most frequently, Valet, Concierge, and Bell Services provided unparalled hospitality. After such a long stay it was nice to have so many greet me by name and friendly smiles. In addition, every other staff member I came in contact with: Restaurant, Maintenance, Front Desk, Banquets, Housekeeping, A/V, were amazingly pleasant. I could easily provide a list of names of exceptional staff members. Although I was anxious to get home, I was saddened to leave my new Belvoir Atlanta family. If I am ever in the area again, I would stay at this hotel in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in the Downtown area.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to the highway.
title: Some problems
comment: At arrival at the room the small refrigerator did not work and we needed it to keep some medicines. The staff replaced at once, but the new one did not work either, so they replaced once more. Then the safe did not work and they send someone to fix it and then everything was OK. The staff was helpful, but...

title: Very nice!
comment: Upgraded to a beautiful corner room! Lounge and room service were excellent. Friendly, helpful staff. Location is central to downtown.

title: Thomas
comment: Great location, poor front desk and overall room. "heavenly bed" was terrible, i actually slept on the floor that night, lamp shades didn't match, bulbs were out, soap was all over the shower curttains, burn mark on the window curtain. really upset i was told there was no king bed avail, but when i called BPG reservations they instructed me they had plenty.

title: Terrible with groups
comment: I was booking a group and the hotel could not get the rooms, the check out dates, or the needs straight.

title: Bad Service
comment: Room services made serveral errors, they even called twice and woke us up to ask questions we had clearly marked on our order, the room was dirty ( stained rug, stained bed spread, and the carpet turned the bottom of my socks black!, the chair at the desk had torn fake leather on it, the bathroom was REALLY small, and we needed a HCP room with two beds and a hotel of that size has none. I stayed so I could get my BPG points but next time its not worth it, I'll forgo the points and stay somewhere nicer, cleaner and with better services.

title: GOOD HOTEL GETTING BETTER
comment: IT WAS OBVIOUS FROM THE MOMENT I WALKED INTO THE LOBBY, THAT THE DELFINA REFLECTED A REFINED AMBIANCE ACHIEVED BY A CARING STAFF.

title: Excellent
comment: Rooms

everyoneShouldKnow: Absolute best hotel for sesame place
title: Accommodating staff & comfortable rooms
comment: Clean and comfy rooms. Staff very helpful. Great location. Only complaint was when reservation includes " free" breakfast, coupon should be given upon check- in. We had to go down each morning and ask for the coupon voucher ( a bit cumbersome).

title: There is the good and then there is the bad.
comment: When I first arrived, the hotel did not look as good as I had thought it would from the pictures online. I was more disappointed to find out that the hotel was under renovation, and one of the key features of the hotel (outdoor pool) was being remodeled. I wish this was mentioned somewhere on their website. The staff was very friendly and very efficient upon check in, it took it no longer than a couple of minutes to get our room keys and our bags in the door. The bathroom could use some updating, it is more standard than what I thought a Belvoir hotel would offer. Speaking of things they should offer at no additional costs, the Wi-Fi was an additional fee, but that wasn't too much of a problem because they do have a complimentary computer station on the main floor for guests. They also do not offer complimentary breakfast with the room. I hope I can stay here again once renovations are finished.

title: Over the top service!!!
comment: Some girlfriends and I came into town for one of our birthdays...The lovely folks at the Seattle Belvoir went above and beyond to make our stay extra special...I will always choose them first the next time I stay in Seattle. Just cant say enough how great our weekend was and alot of that was the customer service at the Belvoir!!!!

title: Great Staff
comment: The staff at this hotel is one of the best I have ever experienced they want to help you in any way possible. The location can not be beat you are on the circle and right in the middle of everything Indy has to offer.

title: SA Trip
comment: Perfect location. Great historic hotel. Very impressed

title: NYC Visit
comment: The hotel overall was excellent and a great location--tonly two items for suggestion, will be even better when rennovations are cpomplete and the check in process is slow, could improve the service there.

title: A little worn for wear
comment: While adequately comfortable, the room and halls had stained carpets and furniture. What really surprised me was that the bathroom sink faucet wasn't fastened to the sink, but was wobbly, requiring both hands to turn it on, adjust pressure and temperature, and turn it off. I might expect these deficiencies in a $60/night room, but not a $160/night room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't judge this book by its cover. The somewhat dated exterior doesn't do this hotel's staffing and interior any justice.
title: 2 Nights were a pleasant stay.
comment: Staff was professional and very friendly.

title: Love the upgrades
comment: My wife and I come frequently here for a nice weekend getaway. We are Grandbourne Gold members and were upgraded to club level room with a view of the city. We were allowed to check in early and leave late the next day which made it feel like we actually spent 2 days there for the price of one. Rooms are exceptionally cheerful!! We will definitely return.

title: Bar Tender
comment: You have an elderly man working your bar who is not interested in serving customers.

title: Love this hotel
comment: This will be the 4th year that I have stayed at this hotel while attending a festival at Merriwether. The hotel's location is perfect! I can walk to the pavilion if the weather allows and I absolutely love Clyde's, which is just around the lake. The staff has always been very polite, friendly and more than helpful. The rooms are always clean and if I ever need anything..it is only a phone call away. This particular weekend can cause chaos at the hotel due to the large number of people converging upon it at one time. The staff each year is stellar!! They go out of their way to make sure that every hotel guest is satisfied! And they do all of this with a smile on their face the entire time!

everyoneShouldKnow: The location,cleanliness,comforable bed,fabulous food and a helpful and friendly staff.
title: Son's Wedding Weekend
comment: Our son and daughter-in-law chose the Chart House for their Wedding Reception.They wanted close hotel accomadations.They visited the Belvoir at Lincoln Harbor and were very impressed by the location and friendliness of the staff.We had family from afar.We hosted the rehearsal dinner and morning after breakfast at the hotel.The food was superb and the staff was terrific!Thank you all.

title: Nice Stay!
comment: Michael-

title: Bad Experience
comment: Dirty, rude staff. Hot tub out of order, television broken and the staff was very rude, even the manager I spoke to....wouldn't recommend. Location, however is convenient.

title: BUSINESS HOTEL
comment: I HAVE STAYED AT THIS LOCATION DURING THE WEEK AND WAS HAPPY WITH THE ACCOMIDATRIONS. THSI TIME THE BATH WAS CRAMPED AND SHOWER WAS MILDEW STAINED. A SERIOUS FIGHT BROKE OUT JUST OUTSIDE OUR ROOM AT 3AM AND WENT ON FOR QUITE A WHILE. NO APOLOGIES THE NEXT MORNING ON CHECK OUT. THE MANAGER DID CALL LATER TO ASSURE ME HE WAS PLANNING TO LOK INTO THE INCIDENT FURTHER.

title: Nice rooms, great location, but poor service
comment: Room was great and very spacious for NYC standards. Excellent location as well.

title: Friendly and Fantastic
comment: We stayed here between legs of our trip. We were very VERY pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. The hotel was clean, updated and felt very fresh.

title: Great place, great price
comment: I'm an BPG Gold member, and this is a pretty good Cat 2 property. The renovation looks great, and teh rooms were fine. Only annoying thing was $10 parking, but that's not a huge deal!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is the worst Belvoir I've ever been to.
title: Not To BPG Standards.
comment: I'll just copy my emailed complaints to the General Manager and BPG. For the record, neither of them have responded with even an acknowledgement of getting my email. What poor customer service!

title: Weekend getaway
comment: Just wanted a short weekend getaway. The Universal Belvoir has certainly upgraded since my last visit. It is a beautiful facility and I can't say enough about the professional, courteous staff. There was always a smile and greeting. They were HAPPY to help in any way possible and I will be taking many more weekend getaways now that I've discovered this untapped treasure in So Cal.

everyoneShouldKnow: Inspect everything in your room before you get settled!
title: Nice Looking Hotel
comment: We checked into our room and noticed that on the inside of the bathroom door looked as if it had fesus smeared on it. We had concert tickets and were running late that night so we told the girl that checked us in what we found. She simply said we will have it cleaned! Rushing we left, on our arrival back we found that no one had cleaned the room and it was now 1:00 in the morning. Appalled we call and asked for a manager. We were told by Maria the mananger that she would change the room to the same kind of room on the same floor. We had to get our things together, move to the new room to find that the sink was stopped up in the bathroom! We are very disappointed at our stay and were treated like Oh Well! I will never stay here again and to be memebers we expected to be treated with more respect than that!

title: WEDDING PARTY
comment: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!!

title: Great Hotel Friendly Staff
comment: My husband and I had driven all night and arrived at the hotel at 5 a.m. on Friday Morning. We had reservations for Friday and Saturday night and wanted to see if we could rent a room until our room opened up. The staff went above and beyound our wildest expectations and were able to check us into our room. We were able to go to our room and go to sleep without having to move at noon.

title: Wonderfully friendly staff
comment: Stayed at the hotel with a couple of friends for a long weekend. We were all very impressed with how friendly and helpful the entire staff was. Everyone from the front desk to the fabulous wait staff at the restaurant. They made us feel so welcomed.

everyoneShouldKnow: nicely located between central park and times square.
title: weekend getaway disappointment
comment: first no one could find my reservation. then they booked me into a room but told me they could not change the rate at the desk to honor either the Sr rate or AAA rate that I had originally booked with as they cannot change rates at book in.

title: Excellent Hotel & Staff
comment: Beautiful location and hotel. Very clean and great staff.

title: Great hotel, convieniently located to downtown Orlando
comment: *Great rates

title: OUTSTANDING SERVICE
comment: The service was top notch in all respects at the hotel. Would specially like to commend Chaoth, and Sarah for their professionalism in the service at the Belvoir Club Lounge.

title: front desk Excellent "Zack"
comment: This trip " Zack " front desk staff , was just superb, went out of his way to assist, finding transportation, eateries etc.

title: Poor customer service by the Hotel Manager
comment: I had a very poor experience at the hotel front desk and extremely arrogant and rascist behaviour by the hotel manager in charge Ms. Kanoe. very much unlike Belvoir experience that I am used.

title: Good stop over for airport
comment: The hotel is very well located and the shuttle to the airport is on time and drivers great.

title: Great hotel
comment: This is a great hotel. It's quiet and very comfortable. It's close to all the wonderful downtown stores. It's close to the Isle of Shoals boats. Staff is very welcoming.

title: This hotel has issues
comment: The staff at this hotel is outstanding and did their best to assist (Ms. Jackie in the Concierge Lounge / Mike in Security, etc...) My first room smelled of mold and wasn't clean. The second room was much better. I was locked out of my room four or five times requiring the assistance of the front desk (please note that I kept the keys in a pocket separate from any magnetic sources.) My keys also did not work on the Concierge Level - told that "there have been issues with access / the door." It felt like I spent more time out of my room vs. in my room - an unpleasant experience!

title: The Big Easy
comment: Upon rival hotel is breath taking. Lobby is outstanding veiw and design. This hotel in great location from main street in New Orleans.

everyoneShouldKnow: Overpriced with extremely poor service. Really nice lobby and great location
title: Great location but poor service
comment: My family and I have stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions and I have to say our previous stays were very good. This stay however was not the same experience. The hotel experience all but ruined our vacation to disney. I would recommend staying at another hotel based on the poor service at the Dolphin. Hotel is overpriced for the service you receive and attention you receive. To start things off we waited over 30 minutes in line to check-in. Upon checking in our rooms were not ready. They told us they would call when the rooms were ready. They did call us and we left Epcot and returned to the hotel to find our rooms were still unavailable and the call was made in error. This is after waiting another 30 minutes in line to speak with someone at the desk. The front desk is far too understaffed. The hotel charges some $14 a day for resort fee including two bottles of water. We did not receive any water during the stay. Instead we called the desk and they said we could come down and get it...really? Just another way they attempt to scam you. The door to our room was broken and nothing was done to fix it. I can go on and on but I will spare the rest.

everyoneShouldKnow: Like I already said... work out your personal preferences regarding your stay!
title: Nice stay but disappointed with the communication with my reservation
comment: The rooms are clean, the beds are great--view was wonderful--but be sure you confirm and even reconfirm what amenities you would like. I was misinformed multiple times when I made my reservation so it was a little frustrating and embarrassing when what I was offered at the time of the reservation did not prove true. So be savvy and assertive with what your expectations are and you will be happy with this hotel. If I stay there again I will make them email me confirmation about what is discussed on the phone. I have stayed at this hotel twice and it happened each time.

title: Exceptional staff!
comment: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from May 10-12 for my daughter's college graduation nearby. I had booked a suite because I wanted extra space due to a knee injury which requires crutches and a wheelchair. When we got to the room, the layout was very cramped and awkward. When I called the front desk to ask if there was another suite, 2 Nicoles and the Asst. Mgr worked with my situation and offered to upgrade us to the Governor Suite at no extra charge which had a much more open floor plan and worked out perfectly! Thanks so much!! Also, special thanks to Beverly in the Club Lounge for being so friendly and helpful and arranging for us, my daughter and her boyfriend to be able to order room service right in the lounge! Thanks to Linda from room service who was kind enough to come up and take our orders and bring them to us in the lounge on the evening of the 10th. At approximately 5:45am on May 12 the fan or vent right over our bed started making a horrible, loud grinding noise and woke me up. Special thanks to Tom at the front desk for being sympathetic but informing us that maintenance did not arrive until after 7am and assuring us that someone would come take a look at it as soon as they came in. The noise continued for over an hour, making it impossible to get back to sleep. When it suddenly stopped at around 7:00, I spoke to Tom again and informed him and he said he would make a note and have someone check on it after we checked out and offered us free breakfast coupons. The noise came back for about 5 minutes once later. Check out was a computerized mess. We were charged for the first night separately because the second night was on points but apparently they had charged the card we gave them at check in (even though we had said we would be changing card at check out) without giving us the itemized bill under the door for us to check on! When we had returned to the hotel on the evening of the 11th, our keycards did not work and had to be reprogrammed, and a new $50 deposit had to be left for the second night, which was inconvenient and confusing When my husband tried to use the card to get up to the club lounge for breakfast in the morning, it didnt work for that either. When he went to the desk, the woman told him that since the room was under my name, I would have to come down with ID to authorize the card or something but since he didnt want me to have to come downstairs on my crutches or in the wheelchair, he told her nevermind. At check out, Kyle was very nice and apologetic about all the mix ups. Despite all the glitches, because of the exceptional staff, I would definitely stay there again, in fact, I look forward to when I can get around better to I can explore Springfield properly. Thank you!

title: of importance to me, overlooked by hotel
comment: Unfortunately, despite the fact that you have a wonderful facility, my initial exposure upon arrival was woefully inadequate. On three occasions prior to my arrival, beginning in February '12, I personally spoke to someone at the hotel to insure that UPON MY ARRIVAL there would be a rollaway bed in our room. I was assured that there would be. Despite these assurances, when I arrived there was no rollaway in the room and it did not arrive for one hour during which time I did not unpack a single item. Having the bed there was of importance to me----otherwise I would not have called three times prior to my arrival.

title: A very comfortable hotel
comment: We were very pleased with our stay in your hotel. The suite we occupied was well appointed and spacious, and we slept very well in the comfortable beds. I was very pleased to find guest computers in the lobby and the snack bar for a quick breakfast one early morning. The staff was polite and efficient. We enjoyed a supper one evening outside by the pool.

title: The front desk staff was excellent!
comment: The front desk staff was excellent! I arrived early to check in and rooms were not available yet. The front desk agent gave me information on where I could find a nice lunch spot on the water in La Jolla and told me I would receive an upgraded room due to my BPG Good status when I returned. My room was very nice with a large living room and bed room.

title: Really disappointing food
comment: We ordered breakfast from room service. We were charged for something that was indicated as being included. I called and it was rectified - without apology- breakfast was honestly inedible - cold and tasteless I've had way better breakfasts at simple diners for literally a quarter of the price. We should have learned our lesson. Before checking out we went to Quinn's for lunch simply because we re not so mobile anymore with our baby. Service took over 35 minutes without apology and food was cold when it did arrive.

title: Clean, but Average
comment: Stayed at the Belvoir downtown overnight for a function I was attending. I'm a resident of the Triangle, but didn't want to drive home late at night. I was not impressed with the staff at all. Front desk was snarky. Club level lounge was below average in terms of food, refreshments, size and atmosphere. Location was convenient and the room was clean, but small. I would not jump at another chance to stay at this location.

title: Nice staff, good location, satisfactory accomodations
comment: Nice staff, good location, satisfactory accomodations

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a superior staff who will make you feel right at home
title: Nice property with a great staff
comment: The property is a bit dated but it is comfortable. The excellent and kind staff is this hotel's greatest asset. From the front desk to the Club level, everyone was kind, attentive and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best place to stay in Ft. Lauderdale
title: Best stay ever!
comment: We just returned home after a fabulous stay. Everything was perfect and the staff was outstanding! The view from our ocean front balcony room was spectacular. This was our third stay and we hopefully will be back soon. We would definitely recommend this hotel as THE place to stay in Ft. Lauderdale.

everyoneShouldKnow: IF YOUR UNIT IS IN BY THE LAKE AREAS BEWARE OF THE BUGS THAT MIGHT FOLLOW YOU IN.. I WOULD RECOMMEND BE AROUND THE POOL AREA AWAY FROM THE PALM TREES ETC..
title: HOTEL WAS FANTASTIC BUT HAD A BUG PROBLEM
comment: FIRST AND FOREMOST THE ROOM AND THE FACILITIES ARE FANTASTIC. THERE ARE MANY POOLS TO KEEP YOU BUSY. THE ONLY PROBLEM WAS THEY WEREN'T CLEANED OFTEN ENOUGH . A LOT OF DEBRIS. THE ROOMS WERE VERY CLEAN AND SPACIOUS . THE ONLY DOWNFALL WE HAD ON OUR STAY WAS ON THE SECOND NIGHT MY WIFE WAS AWAKENED BY A COCKROACH ON HER HAND UNDER THE SHEETS ABOUT 3 1/2 INCHES LONG. NEEDLESS TO SAY THIS HINDERED OUR SLEEPING BECAUSE WE NEEDED TO KEEP LIGHTS ON . THE STAFF WAS NOTIFIED AND RESPONDED QUICKLY WITH A CLEANING CREW AND TERMINATOR SERVICE . THEY MOVED EVERYTHING TO CHECK FOR ANY BUGS. THE STAFF OFFERED TO MOVE US BUT WE WERE ALREADY UNPACKED AND STOCKED WITH GOODS .I WAS SATISFIED WITH THE SERVICE BUT IT DIDN'T HELP MY WIFE WHICH WAS NOW OBVIOUSLY CHECKING EVERY NIGHT TO SEE IF THERE WAS ANYTHING AND LEAVING LIGHTS ON JUST IN CASE. OF COURSE WE DIDN'T TELL OUR CHILDREN WHAT HAPPENED CAUSE THEY DEFINITELY WOULD BE FREAKED OUT .WE STILL WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN BUT WOULD NOT BE IN THE SPA SECTION OR ANY SECTION NEAR THE LAKES. I BELIEVE DUE TO THE AMOUNT OF FORESTRY AND SHRUBS IN THESE AREAS THIS IS WHY WE HAD A PROBLEM. THIS IS WHY I ONLY GAVE COMFORT A 3 STARS RATING. OTHER THEN THIS OUR STAY AT THE RESORT AND FLORIDA WAS FANTASTIC . THEY DID GIVE US A COUPLE OF HOURS OF EXTENDED STAYING TIME BEFORE CHECKING OUT.

title: Very clean, friendly staff
comment: Very clean and exceeded our expectations, has a shuttle to drop off at the secacus for nj transit to Penn station. This was very convenient. Sheets very clean, room very clean and great aroma.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location to all parks and restaurants
title: Wonderfull updated property
comment: What a great transformation from 1 year ago, new refreshing lobby, coffee shop and bar. Two great pools, fitness center. And the BPG rooms have been updated to new comfortable ammenities

title: Bugs :(
comment: I used to love this hotel, but our last stay was horrible. We stay here almost every time we go to Disney, we are pass holders so that's means often! Mothers day weekend and my daughters birthday was a beautiful, fun- filled day until we returned to the hotel about 11:30 and found a large roach- like bug in our bathroom! It was too late to get a new hotel and my 3 kids were scared and crying. Very disappointed in how this was handled :(

everyoneShouldKnow: Not To Stay Here Until Its Been Upgraded To Belvoir Stantards.
title: What A Zoo
comment: I upgraded to the Belvoir being that the prior hotel i checked in was a nightmare! (Hair in the bed,food on the floor..ect.)

title: This hotel is located in University City
comment: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times throughout my daughter's college years because of the location. For the past few years the hotel has met our expectations. However, I had booked our room nearly a year ago for graduation. I found the room to be kind of shabby and it had a well used appearance.

title: Great Renovations
comment: Wow! This hotel sorely needed a renovation and the one that is in progress is great. I stayed in a premium room and the changes were great. I have stayed here on my trips to NY for the last four years and plan on doing the same in the future. Staff very professional. Breakfast delivered to room on time and as ordered. Job well done!

title: Will stay again!
comment: Will look forward to staying again when I am in the Tampa area. was 30 minutes from my meetings but.... definitely woryh it. LOVED the menu in the restaurant and the staff and bartender were soooo nice and accomodating! They even had the kitschen make me a special cheese tray1 YUMM!!!

title: Late Check In
comment: Denise Dennis Was so friendly and helpful with our late arrival at the hotel. I felt taken care of.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir Wild Horse is a great resort property.
title: Family Favourite
comment: Spent 2 nights at the Belvoir Wild Horse Resort & Spa during spring break.

title: Service a plus
comment: Overall good experience. Staff was responsive to request for room change due to bath not being clean.

title: Great hotel
comment: My husband told me that this hotel had bad reviews but it was the only place available. I was very apprehensive but once we got here I was pleasantly surprised and please. The rooms are awesome, clean and comfortable and the rates are very low. Very happy!!

title: Cramped & dated
comment: The rooms - Old and dated. Try to not be close to the elevators as they make more noise than usual

title: Great location, very friendly sraff
comment: Very friendly staff and that I was reminded about my anniversary date at check in by Kellen. It was very much appreciated. Great location on the 16th Street Mall.

title: Comfortable Stay - Excellent Service
comment: My family recently stayed at this hotel and feel it was a good value. Service staff was very courteous and accommodating. Recently remodeled rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed. Bathroom was a little small, but sufficient and also nicely done. Spacious pool area, but spa was low on water. This hotel is located in the heart of Omaha's busy west side, but is secluded enough that noise is not a problem at all.

title: Poor reception
comment: The hotel itself is nice. It is located about a 10 minute walk from the beach.

title: Noisy Room/ Bad Customer Service
comment: During my recent stay at the Belvoir Atlanta Perimeter North at check in, I requested a room away from the ice/soda machines to insure room was quiet as I had a very long travel day and needed to be fresh for my customer meetings in the AM. Although the agent who checked me in promised the room was very quiet, it was in fact the noisiest room I stayed at in this property! Not only was it directly facing the soda/ice machines but also the AC/heat unit was running endlessly at night even after I shut-off the thermostat completely. I decided to speak to the morning manager at check out but he was unavailable. The agent assured me I'll receive a call from the manager on duty but I never received any calls. Not planning to return to this property based on their horrible customer service.

title: Solid Choice in Times Square Area
comment: I was very well treated by the staff, the room was very clean and comfortable...and you can't beat the location IF you want to be close to crazy Times Square.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a walking bridge on the second level that takes you right to the mall and some good places to eat.
title: Navy Blue Wallpaper
comment: I really liked the room decor, it had a great looking navy blue wallpaper that gave the room a rich look and feel. There was easy access to the mall as well to go walk or grab a bite to eat.

title: May 2012 stay
comment: Nice room, excellent location. Two small comments. 1) My bill was wrong ( I was overcharged) and I spent about 45 minutes in line and then at the front desk getting it corrected. 2) When I checked in I was offered a 4PM check out as a Gold member but when I called down to request it the next day I was told 1PM was the latest I could check out. Despite these two comments, I would definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location downtown Dallas next to Arts district.
title: Great Hotel
comment: A beautiful hotel w. very curteous staff. Beautiful clean room. Only complaint: the bed was worn out and uneven.

title: Rooms in bad repair
comment: Worst business hotel experience in years. Room carpet had lots of stains, including large one right as you walk in. Bathroom sink wouldn't drain. Remote batteries dead. AC unit leaked onto carpet. Bed extremely uncomfortable - way too soft. Didn't sleep the first night for more than an hour at a stretch.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to the airport and not far from downtown.
title: Very Nice
comment: Very nice hotel. Would recommend it.

title: Platinum guests have no recognition whatsoever
comment: So this is the first time I stayed at this specific Belvoir. I will never stay there again. The staff that lived in the vicinity of the hotel were clueless to directions around their neighborhood. The "platinum preferred room" was a room with twin beds. The breakfast that platinum members get? Was a pastry and an orange juice in a box. Totally unacceptable. I've stayed at other chains with no status and still received better treatment. I'm shocked to see this type of treatment especially from a location as busy as this. You'd think they want us to not come again.

title: Terrible service
comment: My wife, two young daughters and I had to wait for two hours to check in. We did not get into our room until six pm. The girls missed their naps and we were late for dinner with friends. The night was a mess. I travel a lot and stay in a lot of hotels. This was the worst experience I have had and it cost 500 dollars.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel but Shuttle sucks - better to post you do not have a shuttle if it's not geared to service the local train station. Also it's 2012 ...why should you pay for internet if you spend >$200 on a hotel room???
title: Some great and some bad features
comment: Nice hotel but Shuttle sucks - better to post you do not have a shuttle if it's not geared to service the local train station. Also it's 2012 ...why should you pay for internet if you spend >$200 on a hotel room???

title: great newly renovated rooms
comment: Rooms were great, staff was great, pool was good. Location is a bit out of downtown but fine if you have a car. Only slight beef was as platinum members we ended up with one of the few rooms without a balcony, but other than that everything was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't take a cab from the airport unless you want to spend a fortune!
title: Misleading Taxi Fare Information
comment: The hotel's website says that taxi fares to and from SFO airport run $70. This is just not true on the "from" side. The meter indeed reaches around $70, but (surprise!) the taxis are allowed to charge 150% of the metered fare for out-of-city trips originating from the airport. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk clerk (after having to pay in excess of $100 for the cab) she just shrugged and admitted the information was incorrect for trips from the airport -- "sorry about that." Had I known the cost would be so outrageous I would have arranged a shuttle. Otherwise it was a standard Belvoir and perfectly fine -- as long as you don't mind hearing the train that runs right alongside it. Convenient to Stanford.

title: Great Location/Room/Service/Restaurant
comment: Enjoyed everything...stay much too short. Will return though!

title: Excellent Location; Great Hotel
comment: The Belvoir is very close to all of te shopping, casinos, and boardwalk. The hotel has a nice club lounge and as an BPG Platinum we were upgraded to a modern and huge suite (might have been Presidential). The staff was friendly. A great hotel overall.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poorly managed hotel with poorly trained staff.
title: Worst Hotel Ever
comment: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at, but the staff tried to be helpful. Club level room was reserved. Told at check-in we could not have club breakfast. Issue was resolved, and we were taken to our room, which had not been cleaned. Went downstairs and had luggage stored, Returned hours later and were taken to a very smokey room. We were then taken to another room, which had only one bed for four people. Next taken to room with person in it. Finally taken to non club floor room, where we stayed.

title: Exceptional
comment: We have family in South Florida so we frequently stay at area hotels. My husband also travels frequently for work. We have booked over 30 hotel nights in 5 months this year. This hotel has a great location. There are two malls nearby (Sawgrass and Westfield) as well as countless restaurants. The staff is exceptional, the met every request with a smile. The rooms were clean. The Internet was acceptable. We have a hotspot but did not need to use it. When we return this hotel will be my choice. Suggestion: The pool and jacuzzi need to be repainted. Common areas refreshed. See if mall owners can improve empty building surrounding hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic location but Executive club not value for money.
title: Great Location - but overall stay spoilt by sloppy administration
comment: For some unknown reason I had to book the Saturday and Sunday nights on separate reservation from the following Monday to Thursday (conference) On check in it was confirmed that I could keep the same room and have one bill at the end of my stay. Room was fine ( but bathroom rather tired).

title: Cleaniness of the Room
comment: I stayed here for 3 weeks. When I arrived you can tell housekeeping put no care into cleaning the room. The sheet skirt was stained with coffe stuff all over the floor. The bathroom was half cleaned. I contact the manager of house keep and two people can ensuring that some would fix the problem. The problem continued the entire stay. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Clean Hotel, Friendly and Attentive
comment: My stay last only 15 hours overnight but the staff could not have been more friendly. My room was updated and clean. Exceeded my expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT LOCATION! Bourbon Street within 2 blocks...Harrahs within 2 blocks. Trolly right outside hotel on street.
title: Great experience
comment: I had a conference for a week at this hotel and stayed here as well. The staff and room were excellent!!! I'm glad I had meetings during the day because there was construction going on in the room above me...which my fiance didn't care for but it got him up and sight seeing early in the day! :-) Would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting NOLA. Great times!

everyoneShouldKnow: Porters crab cakes and filet. Don't miss either. Valet staff are top notch.
title: Makes business travel feel like a vacation
comment: I have stayed at Read House more times than I can recall and it is always a pleasure. Food is first rate and the staff will strive to meet your request with speed and a smile.

title: The features are great but some problems with service.
comment: There were some issues with my commode and housekeeper.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're having a meeting and need to sleep, this may not be where you want to be.
title: The people are the best thing here.
comment: First, the good: Absolutely wonderful people.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gym is large with weights, cardio, and couple breakout and circuit rooms
title: Amazing customer service and staff
comment: As a Platinum guest, this is one of the best Belvoir hotels I have stayed with amazing staff and service. The staff is friendly and goes above and beyond to support the client's need. There is a great gym, longue, and convenient location.

title: This hotel has so much potential
comment: The good:

everyoneShouldKnow: As a BPG member this is a terrible reflection on a great name. I will be staying at Westin next time.
title: Improvement Needed
comment: 7th floor club room was unacceptable. large moldy spot above closet was first indication of the lack of attention in these rooms.

title: Hotel is showing its age
comment: This Belvoir is comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful. Parking is $8.00 per day, unless you are in a suite, and even persons with handicapped placards are charged. Parking is at a premium when the hotel is full. When the hotel is at a lower capacity of guests the boilers for the hot water are cut back and it is necessary to let the water run for several minutes to get hot water. The wallpaper in the bathrooms is beginning to peel and is very noticeable. The curtains in our room were somewhat threadbare and light shone through in several small spots, looking like stars. You will want to get an oceanfront suite, floor 6 or higher with a balcony. You can see the oceans, about 2 blocks away, and the view of the Grand Strand of hotels is great at night. The pool is only 3' 6" deep. This hotel is a cat 2 and if that is what you expect, you will not be disappointed.

title: Best hotel in Wilmington
comment: Great staff that really values loyalty

title: Wonderful staff
comment: The hotel is nice. The staff was fantastic. Food was very good and affordable. However, for the price not having a microwave and fridge in the room was unfortunate. Also have to pay to have wireless in the room. Have stayed at less expensive hotels who had more to offer.

title: San Antonio Belvoir
comment: Great Hotel, great location if your interested in visiting the River Walk. Centrally located for all of San Antonio.

title: Absolute disaster
comment: We personally designed our 10 days Best of South Florida tour trip with the help of our guide book and Tripadvisor. It worked out very fine everywhere except for our Key West accommodation. From the 30th of April to the 3rd of May we stayed at room 333 of the Belvoir suites. The gap between the sweetened reviews and the sad reality on site is unbelievably huge. Some reviewers can impossibly have stayed at that same place. How come nobody complains about the invading plane and airport noise, the obvious signs of wear and tear in the rooms, how come nobody points out the high chlorine levels in the pool, the number of Band-Aids and other stuff in the water, the dirty pool towels... The reality on the hotel beach has nothing to do with the beach reviews as well. While we were actually physically there on the beach it featured 1 foot high piles of stinking sea vegetation, the sand is full of cigarette filters, beer bottle capsules and even some used condoms. Homeless have settled underneath the pergolas. Forget the romantic walk on sun down. Past the multi-lingual beggars and the pot smokers you have to fight a myriad of flies.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location to airport with amenities. The rooms are dirty and show significant wear and tear.
title: Worn out and dirty room
comment: Our suite in the Marina Tower was very dirty and the furniture was showing major signs of wear. The rooms (in this tower anyway) appear to be overdue for a renovation.

title: Great hotel
comment: Staff is exellant, hotel is clean and area is spectacular

title: Great Hotel!
comment: Staff is extremely helpful and courteous. Although under construction- hotel is very clean and you can see that it wil be spectacular when completed.

title: Bad Weekend
comment: Staff refused help with luggage and desk had reservations totally confused. Desk called second night and insisted that we had booked two rooms, again totally confused. Employee nearly ran us down in the parking garage after we checked out; he laughed about it and did not apologize although he scared my wife half to death. Very poorly managed hotel. Unsatisfactory attitude with the staff. Only the employees in the bar and grill were competent and polite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful courtyard and very friendly staff.
title: Exceeded my expectations
comment: This was our first stay. We have stayed at the Disney Resorts many times, but didn't want to spend the money this time. The lobby is very nice, the courtyard is beautiful. We had the koi pond outside our back door, which is a nice feature. We needed the help of a maintenance engineer for a minor problem with the back door. He fixed the problem quickly and joked and teased with us. The staff were all exceptionally friendly. I went with my two adult daughters and would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Not what I expect from Belvoir
comment: I reserved a room online, a King with a sofa bed on the Club level for 5/19. I even called to confirm the room because I knew we would be arriving after 4pm, at that time I requested a room close to the elevator because I was having knee issues. I was told there was no problem. When we arrived I was told the room I had reserved was not available, even though I had called to confirm earlier in the day. All they had was a king corner room. I showed the agent my confirmation for a king room with a sofa, (we prefer not to sit on the bed due to back issues), she told me that it was just a request and not a guarantee. She also said I was lucky to even have a room because they were booked up with a basketball tournament and two weddings. One of the elevators was out of service and it took forever to get to our room or to the lobby all weekend. The other elevators had wet floors every single time we got in them. I know that is to be expected when there is a pool, but it was a dangerous situation. Our room, being a corner room, was the very last room at the end of the hall. The light bulb in the bathroom was out, we had to call maintenance to have it fixed. We went to the lounge to have a drink and it was over flowing. There was no policing of the lounge. There was one person staying on the floor that brought an entire basketball team in the lounge and was proud of the fact that they had gotten away with it. So of course there was no soda or water left in the fridge and no snacks to be found. It was also impossible to get a glass of wine or beer as the attendant was nowhere to be found. The scene was the same if not worse in the morning for breakfast, it was a mess, and there was nothing to eat except some bread for the toaster and clumpy oatmeal. There was no silverware or plates or glasses and as each player left the coach was reminding them to take two or three drinks for later. It was extremely frustrating as a paying guest to not be able to use the amenities I paid for.

title: Well run Hotel
comment: I liked everything about this hotel, except when I got a "good deal" on the room....I realize that was because the view was of the rooftop HVAC units........

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very helpful and courteous.
title: Great hotel
comment: We loved our stay at this hotel. It was beautiful and the location was not bad for getting to downtown. Close to the Grand Ole Opery.

everyoneShouldKnow: Have a drink in the lobby and watch the people on the street.
title: Location
comment: My second stay here, and it was as good as the first. You do need to know that the carpet in the halls and rooms is tired and overdue for replacement, but not so bad that I would stay elsewhere. Front desk staff is excellent, bar staff is average, bellmen are excellent.

title: Excellent staff
comment: The staff here is some of the best I have had the pleasure of interacting with in a long time. Everyone is friendly, helpful, and willing to go the extra mile to ensure you get what you need. Location is good, not great.

title: Air Conditioning Unit Very Loud & Bowl of Sink Collapsed
comment: The rooms were fairly clean, but the air conditioning units need an upgrade, they're very loud and a bit outdated. My last morning, they sink bowl collapsed from the base of the vanity...this could have been extremely dangerous if cracked.

title: Excellent service
comment: I had a great stay at the Belvoir Downtown for a conference. I appreciated the proximity to restaurants and shops, the advice on restaurants from the concierge, the spacious room and most of all the fantastic housekeeping staff. I had a problem with my iron and it was not only replaced quickly but I received a personal note and token of apology from the Housekeeping Supervisor Marta. I am a relatively frequent business traveller and I cannot tell you how much I appreciated this.

title: Not recommended
comment: It would be nice to have hot water available when you wake up at 5:00am. I let the water run for over 15 minutes and it never got hot. i met another guest in the elevator and he shared the same problem with me. The clerk at the deak seemed surprised and said I should have had hot water. I gave him my room key and left. The room also had a very musty odor and this was the worst Belvoir that i have stayed in.

title: Great Staff Members & Great Location
comment: Hotel has on-site parking which is a plus in a downtown location. The staff was very knowledgeable of the area and helpful with recommendations of things to do. The staff in the restaurant was very attentive during breakfast also. The location is unbeatable with being only 3 blocks from the stadium. I would definitely stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the Concierge.
title: Very Friendly helpful Staff
comment: We stayed at this property as part of an impromptu trip and were very happy with the accommodations and the staff were very friendly. Bed was wonderful, like sleeping on a cloud!

title: Great for extended stay
comment: The deluxe one bedroom was very spacious, clean and well-designed. Nice pool area with good towel service and a small poolside cafe/bar. Free coffee at reception. Washer/dryer was difficult to operate and there is no oven (range and micro/convection combo). A nice feature were the BBQ grills spread throughout the complex which we didn't use but saw other people enjoying.

title: Relaxing
comment: This hotel is easy to find, convenient to good restaurants and shopping, and is a wonderful respite to the urban area of Trenton. If you have business in Trenton, this is the place to stay. 10 minutes to downtown, easy traffic.

title: Amazing hotel but WIFI needs work
comment: We just finished staying in the hotel, and we found the rooms very comfortable. The breakfast and appetizers in the club lounge were tasty. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did find that the wifi both in our room, in the lobby and in the club lounge did not work very well. We would get connected for a few minutes and then lose the connection. We tried with 3 different devices, and even though we called the technical support line, things did not get any better. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as the location is central and the rooms were fantastic.

everyoneShouldKnow: take it or leave it service
title: We have been cheated by this hotel
comment: Considering the early flight that we were taking next morning, we decided to book the hotel close to the airport and Belvoir is the first choice in our mind and they have a Belvoir Suties hotel close to the airport...That would be a relax night..

title: Training
comment: Upon check in the guest services individual was in the middle of training another associate, but was not able to handle multi-tasking checking us in and helping the new employee. He was kind of rude when speaking to her, and took the phone from her and placed engineering on hold and stated " they can wait". I believe the associate name was Wilson Jr.., can't remember his first name, but he was not very friendly, he did not tell us about the property, the area or make us feel very welcome.I was kind of disappointed thinking a new guest to this property should be welcomed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bar staff does a great job.
title: Great location But housekeeping issues
comment: The location and facilities are good, but housekeeping issues really tanted the stay. My room was not fully cleaned on check-in (trash not emptied) and it too over an hour for housekeeping to respond. The second day of my stay housekeeping did not service the room at all. Front desk staff tried to respond and did good job of customer recovery, but I was left feling like no follo-up with housekeeping would happen. Bar staff is wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will do everything in their power to make your stay as nice as possible.
title: Exceptional Staff - Nice Amenities
comment: The exceptional staff at this hotel made our one night stay a wonderful experience!The reception we received was fabulous --did everything in their power to make us comfortable, cared for and happy thoughout our stay! The pool area is relaxing and enjoyable. Very adequate workout area. Small restaurant, but nice staff and decent food. Our room was only partially renovated ... but, as picky as we are, we were very happy with it. Overall, though, the STAFF made it an exceptional stay!

title: Great potential
comment: Pleased with hotel amenities, including plentiful parking for a handicapped guest, and location proximal to the Boston MBTA . Very satisfied with room rates and offers and staff efforts to provide early check-in. One serious complaint: I was scratched by a protruding, one-inch bed spring when rolling out of bed after my first night. I spoke promptly with the front desk and assured them no great harm was done, but that I wanted the mattress replaced. The staff promised to replace the mattress, and when I returned to the hotel 8 hours later, the spring was gone and the sheets had been changed. I went to bed on the second night only to wake up and be scratched by a different spring. Assuming this wasn't a second defective mattress, the hotel clipped the first spring and left me with the same damaged mattress. Not the customer service-friendly Grandbourne experience I am used to!

title: a nice place to stay
comment: i'd stay again. i recommend it. clean and nice. good restaurant staff.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This is a very nice hotel. I will stay there again next time I'm in Nashville.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect Location and good concierge service
title: The Service is unique
comment: We chose this hotel because it was so close to the airport in Ft. Lauderdale, but we had a nice experience. For us the concierge service is the best ever. We were welcome by Rich in concierge who tried from the beginning to make us feel like VIP's, and he did it right! Whatever we needed he would arrange for us so I appreciate the service I got in my stay. When we left I had a package from Fedex delivered at the hotel which was late before I checked out, so Rich helped me to send it where I needed and he even went to the Fedex office to post it. Great Service!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very busy hotel. Had a lot of conventions and meetings.
title: The worst bath tub I have ever seen!
comment: It's one thing to stay in a downtown hotel that hasn't been renovated, but it's another when the bath room was updated with the exception of the tub itself! There was an actual HOLE in my tub. Very unpleasant and stained. I will not be staying at that Belvoir again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Always clean and dependable rooms and friendly and helpful staff.
title: Dependable room and service
comment: We have stayed at this hotel many times and we always have a nice, clean, spacious room. Paul, at the Front Desk, is friendly and helpful and always remembers us from previous visits. The restaurant and bar staff are friendly and professional. Proximity to the beaches, to restaurants and freeways makes it a good, central location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Requests require follow up until verification received!
title: Poor Followup
comment: As a gold level repeat customer of Grandbourne's largest competitor, I am once again reminded why I left the Grandbourne family.

everyoneShouldKnow: They do not treat Grandbourne Guests well at all...
title: Very disappointed,
comment: I stay at this hotel quite frequently. Every time it seems to get worse. My room key did not work twice, I was not informed about the Club Floor, I have never been offered an upgrade and the staff was not attentive at all. The resteraunt for dinner is not even worth talking about.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay here during prom season.
title: Great location
comment: Comfortable rooms and great club lounge, lobby was also inviting. The only problem was Saturday night there was a prom and was unable to gain entry to the hotel. After being threatened by the attendees of the prom in the parking lot we thought it best to come back at another time.

title: Great staff
comment: The ladies at the front desk were both wonderful when I checked in. We needed 2 rooms and they really worked with me to get the best option since 1 room needed to be handicap accessable or we needed adjoining rooms.

title: Staff was rude
comment: The staff acted like they did not care if I was there. Some of the staff acted more professional then others. Had problems with the reservation and it seemed I put them out trying to fix the problem. That set the tone for the rest of my first time in Kansas City.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The front desk staff at this hotel were incredibly friendly and very helpful. The facilities were nicer than I expected. Beautiful lobby, too.

title: very nice surprise
comment: first stay at this facility. a bit isolated but the rooms are spacious for DC, clean, staff very accommodating. Shuttles to metro and airport are timely and quick.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service was excellent and accommodating. Beds were comfortable.
title: Great experience. Ended up booking 2 more rooms.
comment: We had such a pleasant experience that my in- laws asked us to book them a room. Trevor had the best smile and is knowledgeable about the area. Ashley and Bethany made sure they met our room needs including getting great rates for booking more rooms last minute. Facilities were clean. Solid Belvoir hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service is wonderful. If you need something, just ask!
title: The service made the stay!
comment: I came to Alexandria for some fun and was not disappointed! I enjoyed the area and had a wonderful time, but the staff made all of the difference!

title: Best customer service
comment: The overall staff was great however I would like to acknowledge Elizabeth who is at the front desk. She went above and beyond for me with a issue I had about finding a place to board my doggie on the day of our check out. It was a Sunday and I could not get through to the one that is on Disney's property. Elizabeth did not give just give me the #, she called them and had them get in contact with me. She then followed up with me. She is wonderful and should be acknowledged for going above and beyond. B/c of her this will be my goto resort when I am in Orlando!

title: Great Historic Hotel in Downtown San Antonio
comment: This hotel was wonderful. Beautifully restored historic hotel with very professional staff, clean rooms and nice extras. Centrally located in downtown--only mintues to Riverwalk and The Alamo. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay!

title: Great Customer Service
comment: This hotel has great proximity to the freeways, beaches, attractions and amenities. It is quiet and the staff is very accomodating and friendly. Dinner and breakfast was great too!

title: this hotel has great features
comment: But i would like to see grounds landscaping updated (or at least cleaned up.also great view of river but it was degraded by very dirty windows throughout hotel,also furniture on decks very dirty and old ,everything else very nice ,room was not ready till almost 6pm

everyoneShouldKnow: Not as pricey as a lot of the hotels located directly on the Riverwalk, but you still have immediate access. It has an elegant, old world look and feel. Highly recommended.
title: Beautiful hotel
comment: A slice of old world elegance right in the middle of downtown San Antonio. We had a great stay. This hotel definitely has more of a boutique feel, and its rich history is obvious from the second you step into the lobby. Staff was very attentive, room was super comfy, and it is right across the street from the Riverwalk. This was an incredible value. We'll definitely be coming back to the Gunter the next time we're in San Antonio!

title: Drainage
comment: We were there for the Warrior Dash 2012 and after running through a huge mud puddle!! My husband needed to clean off. The drainage was so bad that the water didn't leave the tub til the next morning. We tried to clean up after ourselves but that was impossible. No refridgerator, microwave, and had to pay for wi-fi...although that is stated when reserving the room...still most hotels give that complimentary. Other than that nice enough hotel.

title: service stinks
comment: Bad choice. Had a early check in for noon and when Ishowed up @ 2:30 the room was still not ready and I was not called until 4 pm to check in.

title: Strike 2
comment: Second stay in a row - maid sevice was a no show. When I notified the front desk that my room hadn't been cleaned or restocked I expected a visit from housekeeping. Never happened. Also, the restaurant formally known as Shula's is now adrift without a concept or a good menu.

title: Great Location for Activities
comment: Hotel is in a great location for visiting Epcot or Disney's Hollywood Studios. Also so convenient to get to the Boardwalk and Yacht Clubs. Restaurants weren't as great as we would have liked. Wish The Fountain would stay open later/24 hours for a good sit down meal.

title: Room cleaness unsatisfactory
comment: The room was never cleaned as it should be. besides that on Saturday the cleaning person came at 9 am and we asked him to come later. I came back to the room at about 12 and the room wasn't cleaned so I called again and the person arrived at 3pm saying that he has 40 rooms to clean and it is difficult for him to come whenever somebody needs his services. To my knowledge the industry guide say that you should asign only 18 rooms per day per maid so if the person was right then you are completly out of the industry regulations and you can't expect the rooms to be clean and your guests to be satisfied.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent service. The people make you feel special and appreciated. Bravo.
title: Fabulous Getaway
comment: My husband and I decided we needed to get away for the weekend and we choose Belvoir Universal. We were not disappointed. From the moment we walked in the customer service was A+++ to infinity. We lounged by the pool, with excellent service, food and drinks. Enjoyed the club lounge for breakfast and appetizers in the afternoon, it was consistently replenished and Jack always greeted us with a smile and met our every need. At the lobby bar we were entertained by our bartender and his knowledge of volkas. Universal city walk was a quick walk to tons of restuarants and live entertainment. What a fabulous weekend we will cherish. THANK YOU Belvoir. We also noticed a manager we nicknamed "the inspector" he was so nice but we saw him everywhere, making sure everything was perfectly clean, stocked and all customers were HAPPY.

title: Quick Overnight Stay
comment: We checked in at 7 PM & checked out by noon the next day. We only interacted with staff upon check in & check out. Staff was friendly. We're BPG Gold Members, but we were not offered an upgraded room. In fact our room overlooked a rooftop. At check out, they didn't ask if everything was ok. If they had asked, I would've mentioned that our toilet barely flushed & wouldn't stop running most of the time (room 336). The noisy A/C was an annoyance. No matter what temp we set it at, it ran nonstop, rather than turning on & off. If we were staying longer, I definitely would've asked for a different room. On the positive side, the bed was very comfortable, & the shower was nice. The lobby was inviting, & the flavored water in the lobby was refreshing. There was some large function going on, & all of those people seemed to be having a positive experience at the hotel. I'd definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location and staff seems empowered to make the guests happy
title: Great location and great view
comment: We've stayed here before and this was another good stay. Staff treated us very well upon check-in, giving us a room on a high floor with a great view down 7th Ave. and also threw in breakfast in the restaurant ($70 value!). Concierge gave good suggestions for things to do and restaurants.

title: No other choice in Palo Alto
comment: I have been staying in this hotel several times over last three years. The hotel is dated; no insulation against noise whether from elevators or patio activities or trains - replacing old windows would be a big improvement. A/C systems are also antiquated and noisy. Overall experience was always somewhat below average (especially for the price charged) but in Palo Alto there are very few choices. Location is convenient. Rooms are clean but provide minimum amenities - only one free electrical outlet for example, no fridge

everyoneShouldKnow: The concierge knows more than you do!
title: Consistent and Comfortable
comment: Stayed at the Seattle Belvoir a number of times and will return again soon. Somewhere between a hotel and a resort. The staff makes the difference! The location is tops too.

everyoneShouldKnow: The layout is bad, staff/service did not help at all.
title: Not good
