comment: Hotel layout is horrible, room layout was bad, not enough light, power outlets or windows and carpet was wet from rain water coming in through the balcony door. Staff was not useful or friendly. Free breakfast included was only provided for one guest per room when two were staying.

title: Hotel Stay
comment: I always like to begin any review with the positive. Overall, my family and I enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir Gateway Hotel. The hotels location was superb as was the view from our room. My family really enjoyed being able to watch the planes leave and arrive to the airport. The front desk staff was very accomodating in getting us an adjoining room, The only negative experience I had during my stay was upon check-in. At check-in there was a long line and four people behind the desk however, only two were checking in guests. I have worked in the hospitality industry before so I understand shift changes however, a courtesy "we will be right with you" or "thank you for your patience" would have gone a long way. To ignore the line of people waiting without soe acknowledgement does not embrace customer service.

title: Clean hotel and great location
comment: This Belvoir is clean, comfortable and has a great location smack in the middle of Back Bay. It's attached to the Prudential shopping and one can walk anywhere from hotel to all points in Boston.

title: perfect
comment: great room and view club lounge incredible

title: It was great
comment: We were recommended by a friend. IT was great. Rooms were big and they accomodated handicapped customers. It was near everything so it made our trip to Boston even more funa dn convenient.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not near the downtown area but centrally located and well appointed.
title: Pleasant stay in modern digs
comment: Hard to go wrong at this nice hotel! The room was nicely appointed, Starbucks in the lobby. Ample parking. Pet friendly!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very busy and very close to times square.
title: Great time!
comment: The hotel was definitely everything we expected. I think we would have been happier when the construction was done so that we didn't have to hear the noises from the floor below but other than that it was great.

title: This hotel had everything I needed, and then some!
comment: I went to NY to meet my son and help him find an apartment. He wanted to live in Chinatown so I booked the Belvoir Tribeca, thinking we would be close to his search area. The hotel is new, it's compact but makes excellent use of space, and has everything one could possibly need beginning with the Starbucks kiosk in the lobby to the Business Center, another restaurant and a knowledgeable and friendly front desk and concierge staff. I made use of the Fitness Center which offers a good choice of equipment and we were upgraded to the Lounge level where I enjoyed the rooftop garden and the amenities of the Lounge on a daily basis. The room was well appointed with a flat screen tv, comfy chair, a desk and chair and an armoire with a safe. The bathroom was pristine with a contemporary flair. The location was not ideal for theatre, museums or Central Park, but I had such a great experience that I would probably stay here again and make the commute!

everyoneShouldKnow: Has Disney level staff efficiency and friendliness
title: Room great, staff better
comment: When we first arrived the reception staff was great. We were excited about our weekend and they immediately picked up on our mood and joined in. The room assigned was great but I thought I had asked for park facing, so I went to ask for the extra bonus - and was immediately given a new room - just as the fireworks started. Main street is the best place to watch the show but the 14th floor of the Park may be second.

title: Another Great Stay
comment: This was our 8th visit and as usual they exceeded our expectations. We were upgraded to a Charles RIver view suite that gave us plenty of room to entertain for Graduation Weekend. The views can not be beat! The bathroom while compact is fine. The staff was extremely helpful with our every request. The location at the Prudential center makes it so easy to get around and everything is right at your door. Thanks again for a memorable trip. Hope to see you again soon.

title: A Great Stay
comment: My friend and I stayed at the Belvoir in May and couldn't have had a better stay! From the moment we checked in the staff was wonderful! We orginally booked a handicap room because that was the only room available online. The front desk confirmed this and we asked if it would be possible to switch into another room. It took a few minutes but they were able to get us a regular room. The rest of our stay was great! We ate at the restaurant and we loved that there was so many things to do in the area. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel.

title: Policy or Not?
comment: When we arrived late in the evening, we requested help with our luggage and were told that there wasn't anyone to assist us. Thankfully, we were allowed to use the luggage cart to transport our own luggage to the 10th floor. When we checked out, we asked for the luggage cart and were told that we could not use it because it was against hotel policy. If this is the hotel policy, then you need someone available at all times to assist your GUESTS.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beds are the most comfortable and great blackout shades
title: Much better than most Belvoirs
comment: This si my third Belvoir in a month and it was so much better than the others. Staff was friendly, helpful and willing to go the extra mile to help. The bed was extra comfortable and after a quick trip from the engineer the a/c worked great and cooled our room beautifully. Easy walking distance to many places. Really a very nice hotel.

title: Good, clean hotel with an excellent fitness center but WiFi is terrible
comment: Overall, a good hotel at a good location. The club lounge was good and the fitness center was excellent. My only two concerns with the stay

title: Bad start, but they did try.
comment: It didn't start off well when I had to wait over 2 hours for my room to be made ready (or "cleaned") even though it was 45 minutes into the start of check-in time already (1530 hrs). The hotel was not forthcoming with concessions, so I had to ask, but to their credit they did give something. I was given access to the Club Lounge, but just for the time I had to wait. After complaining about waiting for 2 hours I coaxed more concessions, but they were not very freely giving either. Nonetheless they did give concessions, a couple of breakfast vouchers, and a $30 room credit, which really was just $25.77 in credit in the end. Prices in general were very high, especially at an in-hotel cafe, and the quality was sub-par for the price.

title: Great Suite
comment: Would highly recommend our room with deck overlooking the pool. Very clean, food was good, staff was friendly. Wish we could have stayed longer.

title: hotel staff not clear on meaning of "adjoining"
comment: I asked for an adjoining room b/c I was traveling with a handicapped person and I needed to be aware if he fell or needed help. The staff put me in a room across the hall and, when I complained, told me that across the hall is "adjoining."

title: Better than expected facilities, great staff
comment: Not quite sure why all the negative reviews - we were only here for one night, but very impressed overall with this hotel. The room was much bigger, and more well appointed, than we expected. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Great fitness center and pool. Had a bit of a problem with checkout and a parking ticket received during the stay, but the manager, Mark B. was super responsive and very helpful in fixing these issues. A great location for visiting the falls - obviously no view of the falls (I don't believe any hotels on the US side have a view), but super close. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Such a great experience in Kansas City
comment: The Staff at the Belvoir Crown Center in Kansas City know how to treat a return customer. They greet me by name, know my room preference, take care of every need that I could possibly have. They are truly upgrading this property and it has so much appeal to someone who finds himself in KC quite often.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent. Always went above and beyond!
title: Wonderful Hotel Great location
comment: This was our 2nd time at this property. The staff is friendly and attentive to your needs. Cory and Jeff at Valet always with a friendly good day or evening and welcome back when we would return from our day outtings. Kevin our bellman was excellent. Lauran at the reception area when we checked out wished us safe travels back to our home with a smile. The staff goes above and beyond in caring for the guests. The swimming pool area are 2 boys enjoyed and it is nice area to just hang out if you don't want to leave the hotel. The room was always clean and comfortable kudos to your housekeeping department. We will stay at this property again when we are in Dallas. Thanks again to all the staff for making our stay wonderful.

title: Good Locale
comment: On the recommendation of a co-worker I stayed at you facility while in the city on business. I am an avid guest of another hotel line, never stay anywhere else, except this time. I have to say that I was pleasantly suprised when I was told the parking fee was waived due to my company's contract (better that the 28 a night at the other place near by). Nevertheless, the following fell short:

title: maid service was terrible.
comment: The people associated with the hotel were very helpful and professional. However, the maid service was very poor. They never removed the garbage from the preious day . When they replaced the towels, they would remove four and only replace them with two.

title: This hotel had terrible access.
comment: I stayed at the hotel on Sunday May 20, 2012. It was very difficult to find access to the hotel. The hotel should have sent information on how to gain access to the hotel, since all but one entry was blocked off by police. I did not mind going through security check points but was very frustrated from finding a way in.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location and updated rooms are great!
title: Stayed in one of the new rooms
comment: LIke another recent guest said, the Belvoir needs improvement. It's a huge property that's nearly always sold out, so that means all staff is busy, but attentive. The new rooms are super nice and comfortable compared to the outdated ones I've experienced in the past. Wi-fi remains woefully unpredictable - drops outs are frequent, complimentary bottled water was not placed in my room during my stay and housekeeping called me at 10:30 am on my first day to see when they could get into the room. I never get to sleep in so that was kind of off-putting. Still, for all its quirks, this is a good, well-located BPG property.

title: Really Dog Friendly
comment: We were glad to find a Club Room which accepted dogs. A GREAT facility is the doggie disposal area across from the car entranceway. No need to brave the streets late at night!

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask if any remodeling is going on and request to be on the other side of the building.
title: Not as good as usual
comment: I usually always stay in this hotel and love it, but for some reason this time they put me in a lower floor, my gold status wasn't recognized, and there was construction going on either in one of the adjacent rooms or above us. When I called the front desk they said they weren't aware of anything and would send up security and nobody showed up, it stopped then started again an hour later, really loud drilling so you could barely speak above it. Not my usual experience, I will give this hotel another try and hope they got their act together...

everyoneShouldKnow: Being unfamiliar with the area, it was a little hard to see the sign from the road. We had to call for further directions
title: Wonderful stay!
comment: Even though we were at this hotel only one night, the service and facilities more than met our expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is amazing service at this hotel. Every staff member we encountered was so friendly!
title: Fantastic Service
comment: This hotel offers everything you need for a great beach vacation. Beach cabana rentals are reasonably priced and there are both casual and nicer dining options available. I would highly recommend the breakfast buffet at Rusty's! There was so much to do on premise that my boyfriend and I rarely left. We played tennis, ate great meals, watched a basketball game at the bar, enjoyed room service and relaxed by the pool/beach. There is even live music and dancing! The fitness center is top-notch with great views overlooking the ocean. I cannot say enough about how pleasant the staff are. I was blown away by how courteous and helpful everyone was.

title: Nice renovations
comment: Staff was awesome. Upgraded room. Very kid friendly. Facilities great. Restaurant very good.

title: Shuttle Staff was wonderful
comment: We like to stay on the go and found the shuttle staff very cordial and informative. A special thanks to Amir (?) for always guiding us correctly.

title: Great location - excellent staff!
comment: After an exhausting day of meetings, I needed a comfortable place to relax and unwind. Belvoir provided that plus more. Great roomprofessional and courteous staff. Bravo!

everyoneShouldKnow: The people working at and running this establishment are top notch.
title: Exceptional in every way
comment: My stay at this hotel was excellent. I can think of no changes that would have made my stay any better. I slept well, enjoying the great environment in the room. Linens were very comfortable. Cleaning crew did a great job. It seemed like there were always service staff in the hallways and elevators, just looking for ways to please. Staff was happy and always pleasant.

title: Excellent stay
comment: Personnel were well professional. It did not hurt they gave me a room upgrade to to view the ocean and bneach.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice decor and clean. Good staff
title: Good Club Lounge
comment: The room was spacious for NYC, although they did not have a room ready for me at 1:30pm when I arrived, so i took a double bed room instead of my king room as reserved and also had to take a lower floor.. As a Platinum member, I thought I would not have to wait until 3pm check-in, she said there were no rooms available, yet the man in line next to me walked up and was able to check in and get a king bed room. I was not offered an upgraded room or the free Continental Breakfast that is supposed to be available for Platinum members.

title: Terrible Experience
comment: One of the worse Grandbourne properties I've stayed at.

title: I'm busy!
comment: When I checked in the guy working the front desk was very preoccupied. I could understand if there were other people checking in, but it was only me. He was not hospitable and friendly the way the staff at other Grandbourne Properties usually are. He never thanked me for my loyalty as a Gold Member (soon to be Platinum). Then on top of that I asked if the Stop & Shop was open and he said it was open 24 hours. It's not. It closes at 12 AM during the week, and I only know that buy walking by walking over after 12 AM to grab a few things only to be turned away. Other than the guy at the front desk and the fact that I selected a king but got a double, the hotel was clean with a great location.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Very convenient and nice staff. Helped with check in and directions.

title: The People made all the difference
comment: I was thoroughly impressed with the people at this hotel and their genuinely caring attitude towards not just me but every one that I saw them interact with. So in short these are the best folks I have ever had the privilege meeting at a hotel. The only disappointment that I faced was with the room itself. I found it to be impeccably clean but the air conditioning malfunctioned on my second night there by freezing solid and then thawing out getting the carpet wet. The staff was friendly and offered to move me to a new suite but at 8pm on my last night there. I stayed in the same room rather than move. I guess I was disappointed that in a hotel this nice with staff this terrific they had less than great facilities.

title: This hotel is service oriented!
comment: We are gold members. That has not meant much in the recent past. This hotel changed that opinion. After we checked in and got to our room the staff called to see if we needed anything. Their attention to good service was wonderful. The workout facility was state-of-the-art. The food at Humphrey's was delicious and well-prepared.

title: Staff very friendly and helpful
comment: While we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, there were two items of concern. The first was when after entering room and putting away our luggage, we put a suitcase behind a chair and found dog feces, which indicated that the chair had not been moved or carpeting vacuumed in that area after the previous guests. However, after calling Housekeeping a member came immediately and took care of the problem.

title: Great Hotel for NY
comment: I've travel to NY often and the Belvoir Towers NY is my home away from home. The hotel is conveniently located with the the metro right outside its door and all the activiites in the city.

title: Great Room
comment: The room was fabulous; rating would have been five stars except for the lack of shuttle service to places I needed to go (although one time of five that I needed to go somewhere, one of the employees agreed to take me even though it wasn't "available.").

everyoneShouldKnow: A very courteous and professional staff.
title: Convenient Location Hotel
comment: The best thing about this hotel is the service.

title: RURAL BRITS
comment: US HOTELS USUALLY REPRESENT EXCELLENT VALUE AND FACILITIES COMPARED TO UK HOTELS. Belvoir FORT WORTH DID NOT DISAPPOINT.

title: RELAXING!!!!
comment: What a wonderful place to just sit and relax! The service was excellent; the grounds were beautifully landscaped and immaculate. The hustle and bustle of Tampa/St. Petersburg seems a million miles away while relaxing on this white sand and surprisingly uncrowded beach. The only reason I would hesitate to recommend this place is to try and keep it a secret! What a find!!!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location with great club lounge.
title: Great Club Lounge, Beautiful Location
comment: I always enjoy staying here, why?

Stay was good. All departments seemed to operate at abot 80% which was the difference between good and great. Have stayed at this hotel many times and have definately had better experiences, but overall stay was good and I would recommend. Best hotel on the beach strip for the kids.

title: Belvoir Miami always hits the mark
comment: This is our fourth stay at this airport-handy hotel in Miami. As always, this hotel totally suited our needs. The staff is kind and efficient. Special thanks to Yury, Miguel and Victor - who have remembered us from past trips and take such good care of us. Sometimes traveling can be stressful, but this 'leg' of our trip is always pleasant, comfortable and hassle-free.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're looking for a quiet place, and find yourself on a noisy floor, check out and find another property.
title: Noisy with poor/no resolution
comment: I was initially checked into a room on a Club level, (I thought), next to a room with a barking dog.

everyoneShouldKnow: The employees are efficient, courteous, and willing to go "the extra mile".
title: Your Staff is Exemplary
comment: My son graduated from college and we hosted a celebration at The Belvoir. Your staff provided service that was absolutely outstanding and made our experience very memorable. From the Food and Beverage department to the Front Desk, the staff paid extreme attention to every detail. We couldn't have been more delighted and thank you for making this event very special!

title: horrible
comment: spider webs in room. really really bad plumbing. toilet, water running etc. Maid knocked on my door at 8:15 am. to clean room on a sat morning the day I was checking out. Woke me up. Would not return!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is on the sand and the pool/outdoor areas are very relaxing.
title: Better outside than in.
comment: This property's fantastic location with step-down access to the white sands of Waikiki and extensive outdoor pool and dining areas makes it a strong contender. There is a quiet adult pool and a much larger family pool area with water slides and water features. Overall, the front desk and valet staff were very professional, welcoming, and accommodating. The rooms are spare and somewhat small, although I expected this based on website pictures and other reviews. However, I was surprised how generally banged up all the furniture was. The room was clean, but all the scratches and dents made it seem less so. The bath is very basic, with no upgraded finishes, but it served its purpose. The mattress was comfortable. Note: partial ocean view was quite removed from the sound/smell of the waves because this is a very large property. Note: if you're not a super-attractive 40's mother or one of her beautiful daughters, save yourself the money for surf/paddle board instruction from the gruff old teacher. He and his staff pay plenty of attention to such travelers (while providing their off-color commentary while the women are out of hearing range). Everyone else gets the short end of the stick. Overall, this place serves the purpose well for someone wanting full access to the sights, sounds, and nightlife of Waikiki, with a comfortable place to rest their head at night.

title: Always a Great Stay
comment: I'm looking forward to my stay in June. This will be the 8th or 9th time I stayed at this hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the restaurants are great and the beach is magnificent but the best thing about this hotel is it's staff. They are outstanding. They are always warm and welcoming and will do what ever to make your stay more enjoyable. In the past I have worked with the sales and conference staff and they always went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. This is just an outstanding hotel and we just keep coming back year after year. The location is wonderful as well. A beautiful beach, a quieter surronding, close to shopping and great restaurants. Just a great place.

title: Great Room, Great Price
comment: This is my go to location when I travel to Chattanooga. This is a great historic hotel with modern amenities. I was able to get a very comfortable room with great customer service. I highly recommend this hotel when traveling on business in Chattanooga!

title: Lobby looks great -Rooms need work
comment: I have stayed at this Belvoir many times, and this was my first stay since the renovation. The first impression was lovely -the new lobby looks nice, the bar and restaurant areas are greatly improved. However, that all ended as soon as the elevators opened... The elevators were the same old, dirty elevators. The hallway was the same carpet and smell as before the renovation. I think the bathroom in my room had been re-tiled, and the bed linens were new, but that was it for the renovation of the guest rooms, at least as far as I could tell. The pipes were still gurgle and noisy, the AC was still VERY loud, etc. I was most disappointed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastically friendly staff and wonderful rooms
title: Wonderful stay
comment: The staff were so friendly and helpful - and our room was perfect. We had dinner in the restaurant and it was outstanding. I would love to come back to this hotel again!

title: Great Find!
comment: It is rare in these days to be truly treated like a guest in a hotel, even as a platinum guest at another major chain I have been treated poorly often. This Belvoir has the kind of hospitality that leaves you speechless. The employees are very friendly and very helpfull. It seems that everybody is glad you are a guest, and they love being able to help you. If you go to Clearwater this is definately the place to stay, the manager of this hotel has created a true oasis.

title: The best in downtown Atlanta
comment: I travel to Atlanta frequently, and the Belvoir on Courtland is my first choice. Most every hotel has some good aspect, but this property has a wonderful staff with great attitudes, comfortable rooms, great food, and what I consider to be the best pool in any Atlanta hotel.

title: Angry and Disappointed
comment: I've stayed at this hotel many times before and generally speaking its been OK. Its not the best or newest of hotels but its suited my business needs until my last experience. I arrived at the hotel at 10pm after coming in from London via Boston. Went to check in but was told the room wasnt available as it hadnt been cleaned. Receptionist said that it would take 30 to 60 minutes. I wasnt happy but these things happen occasionally so I was prepared to live with this if it wasnt going to take more than an hour and I told the reception this. It got to midnight and no one had spoken to me and there was a large line building in reception: i wasnt alone. Lined up for nearly 40 minutes. At around 1am, the reception said that they were not able to provide me with a room (along with about 20 other guests) but they had organised a room at a motel. They provided me with $40 for cab fare. This motel was about 30 mintues (at 1am mind you) out of baltimore and cost $55. It took another hour to get checked in as there were many other people from the Belvoir there. Got a room and the condition of this room was unbelievable. Lock on the door didnt work, stains on nearly every fabric of the room and basically I didnt feel safe. I got to bed at around 3am but had to be back at the Belvoir for a car to pick me up at 7am. Total nightmare. I cant believe this is a Belvoir Hotel. I've never experienced this at a hotel of this alleged level. The staff were doing the best they could but there appeared to be no one in charge: management of the situation was severely lacking. I go to Baltimore regularly and luckily I have some choice where I stay. In conclusion...1. I wont be going back to this hotel; and 2. I will be recommending to my company to remove this hotel from the preferred list. For a business traveller (and any traveller/guest) the experience was unacceptable.

title: Average at best.
comment: First impressions were good; a nice lobby & a friendly welcome, then in to a reasonably well specified bedroom, fairly well appointed although given it was billed as a suite definitely a touch on the small side. But look a little closer and it was well in need of redecoration.

title: Disappointed
comment: At check in, and check out, the BPG desk was not staffed. Had to wait in line both ways. I was not offered a room on an BPG floor, but was given a room on a higher floor as requested. Room was very small. When the pull out desk was extended, you basically couldn't walk across the room. The sports bar was better than expected and a great location for accessing downtown Dallas...

everyoneShouldKnow: The only hotel who is so warm and feel like at home. We feel secured.
title: Feel like at home
comment: Overall that was a great experience. Staff always taken care. My only concern was the stain on the pillow...they migth be changes....make a review of those will be appreciated..food an beverages was good.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is closed to everything, downtown, lake, airport, shopping and many other things to see.
title: Great to be back.
comment: This was my second time in two months.

everyoneShouldKnow: Too quick to apportion off sections of the facility, which you believe you will be able to enjoy, for exclusive corporate events.
title: Beware of corporate events
comment: Overall, I have enjoyed this hotel and have appreciated its amenities and service - not so, during my last stay. On the first full day there, there was a large corporate event that monopolized the main pool area, nearby lap pool and pool bar/cabana area. I received a very disinterested reaction from Guest Services when I complained about the loss of a major section of the hotel's facilities, especially important after a long hot day. The only response was to use the lap pool at the Swan which, as a result, was overcrowded and dirty. I wouldn't mind the loss of a major portion of the hotel's facility if we were compensated in some manner. But no, we were offered nothing, and I was not contacted by Guest Services management as I had requested.

title: Ok stay
comment: Had to wait at the front desk to be checked in.. observed several guests also had to wait... no one to greet... Breakfast to fancy... had to wait for direction, seating, and coffee, cook not ready to make eggs... again waiting... No newspaper at the door. Room clean and nice.....

title: great locaion,wonderful help
comment: stayed at hotel from 5/20-5/24 the help is wonderful,the rooms are clean and the beds are vey comfortable.you can get to anywhere from this location.The only negative I have is that there tv does not offer any kid stations for my granddaughter when she sleeps over

title: improving
comment: The bathroom needs to have grab bars and safety strips in the tub. Housekeeping needs to wait for an answer before entering the room. Decor was excellent, nicely appointed.

title: Great hotel and great service with one exception
comment: Enjoyed our stay. Very clean room, courteous, friendly staff, with the exception of one incident. Needed to borrow a small screwdriver to service my dying laptop. After a couple of request calls (which caused me to miss one of my meeting sessions) a maintenance man knocked on my door and handed me the screw driver. Then, he proceeded into the room and stood about 12 inches away from the desk I was working on. I told him it might take a while and asked he he had to be in the room while I used the screw driver and he said yes "because he needed to use it." When I realized I was going to need to call my company help desk, I closed the laptop back up and told him this was not going to work. I would suggest that the hotel mgt might investigate having a few basic tools on hand for guest that need them which would avoid the need and expense of having employees stand around and supervise the use of a pocket screwdriver that costs less than picking up the phone and dialing a "free" 800 number from the hotel. Otherwise, service was outstanding, however, this incident marred my visit.

title: Dave
comment: Great interior renovation. Pool is beautiful and nice and warm. Food was outstanding. The staff was incredible! Their service was consistently above average. Will definitely returnl

title: Friendly staff, nice facility
comment: I had a good experience - the staff was very friendly and helpful. The fitness center and pool area were large and attractive.

everyoneShouldKnow: Other than location, a very poor value!
title: Tired
comment: Registration staff was very slow and guests were ignored while the lines grew. One person at the desk while others passed by pretending to appear busy, but offered no assistance! No lounge and black mold in the shower area where grout was separating. I thought I was in a roadside motel!

title: Very Welcoming
comment: I was traveling along with small children and was unsure about this hotel but felt very welcomed. The front desk staff were amazingly polite helpful and welcoming, The only concern I had that was negative was the amount of dust on the vents (in the room and bathroom) because my smaller child has severe breathing issues but we didn't have any problems and I imagine if we did, they would have helped in any way to make it better. The free shuttle was the most convenient part of our stay as it alleviated the stress of parking and traffic at the hospital. In short, this hotel was nicer than I would have chosen on my own but I felt very safe and welcome here and thankful for the kindness of the staff, especially one I think was named Buddy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Never gave all 5star ratings. Ever.
comment: Stayed an extra day because this was such a pleasant experience. Ordered room service just to test more dishes. Never saw a manager not filling in to help. How many hotels have seen the managers at all, let alone working. We were treated royally, and yet like friends. An, no, We are Not related to anyone on staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cleanest and Best Located Hotel I've Stayed At
title: Best Hotel So Far and I Travel Often
comment: This is a very clean hotel with great food at a good price. It is pet friendly and the standard rooms are suite sizes. The pool wasn't that great but everything else met or exceeded my expectations

title: Low occupancy does not mean better service
comment: I stayed in this hotel for two nights. After the first night, I approached the front desk for a late check-out the next day. The staff there asked me to check back in the morning. I realized I didn't mention I was Gold so asked her if they made any exceptions for their Gold Elite members and she actually looked at me and said, "Is that in the brochure?"

everyoneShouldKnow: it is a nice place to stay and close to harbor place
title: this hotel was wonderful!
comment: We used this hotel for my daughter's wedding this past weekend. The rooms were clean, the staff was helpful

title: Poor service for a big name Hotel Chain
comment: Discovered the day before our check in day that the hotel had placed us in a regular room with two queen beds vice the suite I had reserved several months n advance. Took four phone calls to finally get the reservation correct. Unfortunately the suite that they finally gave us was in a different section from the rest of our group. This resulted in confusion for some of our group and renting the suite was a waste of time and money. Also, had requested a microwave in the room upon arrival but when we checked in we were told that they did not provide micorwaves. Upon checkout it took over an hour to obtain a cart to transport our luggage from the hotel to our vehicle. Appears that they have a very limited number of carts and people take them to their room the night before checking out. I will definitely "Not" be staying at another Belvoir in the future.

title: Convenient location
comment: The staff is very friendly and competent. I've have been staying here for some years now, and the level of service is very consistent. Club lounge is very comfortable for work, and the view is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are two distinct locations, one of which is VERY far from the desk and entrance!
title: Preferred Guest Points?
comment: My room reservation was made by Admin person, and the extension was not booked upon her request. I extended the stay one night, and the front desk DID NOT ask me to re-initialize my card key, so when I went to my room, tired after a long day, walked the 2-city blocks to my room, (see below), my key didn't work, so I had to walk back two more times.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is good, but there's a lot of construction all around downtown.
title: Long waits to check in
comment: Hotel needs more staff at registration during busy times of check in (3-6 pm). $5 voucher for forgoing maid service is nice, but need larger trash cans in rooms if they're not emptied every day. I like the option to recycle!

title: Bar Stools
comment: Recently replaced bar stools. Big mistake. New stools are about a foot too short and don't swivel. Bring back the old ones.

title: While not recently refurbished, I still recommend, but needs to heat pool
comment: Positives: Great Staff, Great Bedding, Nice Flatscreen/Channel Choices, Nice Lobby and Restaurant, Nice Fitness Center.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location to walk to the convention center.
title: Very nice Property and Good Staff
comment: The check-in associate was smiling and welcoming and thanked me in a sincere and gracious way for being a platinum BPG member. My room was ready early (even though they were very busy). I was upgraded to a corner room with a microwave and refrigerator, very nice!! Great bedding, good Wifi speed. One minor thing was the shower water pressure was not quite what I expect. Good location to walk to the convention center. Self parking is close-by.

title: Nice but a few glitches
comment: While this is a beautiful and clean property, my two gripes knocked my rating down to 3 stars and would have been 5 stars. My gripes are that there was no bottled water in my room (usually two bottles on the house for BPG platinum members). So, I thought fine, I'll walk down to the club lounge and grab some water and a soda. Wrong, this club lounge is not "keyed" so there is no water or soda available off hours from the breakfast or evening social. I walked to the front desk and it took them well over 5 minutes to come up with a bottle of water so I left and went to bed (I got in at 11 PM). I'm sure I'd stay there again when in Charlotte but I wasn't happy with what happened on my first stay.

title: Would Stay Here Again
comment: Convenient location. Nice hotel. Clean room. Wonderful view of the harbour from my room. Would stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are better hotels all over the city of Pittsburgh
title: Deeply Unsatisfying
comment: I stayed here 3 years ago and this hotel hasn't improved at all. The internet is dial-up at best, just like it was 3 years ago and the TV works when it wants to. The staff merely claims that it is out of their hands. Look elsewhere

title: Exceedingly disappointed with service
comment: Very disappointing service to date - and compelled to alert other potential clients regarding our perplexing experience at Belvoir Imperial.

title: typical Belvoir property close to the airport....
comment: had a nice short one night stay here in may, 2012....upgraded to a very spacious bi-level suite on a cheap corporate rate....

title: typical Belvoir property....
comment: had a 2 night stay here recently....pretty uneventful....no suite upgrade as a platinum member but got access to the club lounge....

title: typical Belvoir property close to the airport....
comment: stayed here for a night since the hotel i usually stay in was not available....as a platinum member i was upgraded to a corner suite on a cheap corporate rate....

title: Great getaway
comment: My husband stayed at this hotel for a week while we were looking for houses. Hated to leave. Now we live in Florida, and go over to the Sand Key for a one- or two-night getaway. We still feel like we are on vacation. Great destination spot. Nice pool. Beautiful beach. Great park right next to it.

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to pay for Internet but there are some free wi-fi hotspots available
title: Huge hotel, unbelievable gym
comment: Stayed at this property for a conference. It was a huge hotel - three towers @ 39 floors each! Multiple banks of elevators made getting to your room quite speedy except when an elevator was down. I loved, loved, loved the gym - it could be its own private health club. Only complaint was the A/C in the room - I could not get it to get cool enough ... might be something to do with the automated settings.

title: Not up to par
comment: You know that it's time for an upgrade to the hotel when wallpaper is peeling and there is a 2-foot crack in the shower plexiglass filled with simple, white caulk. This, along with an improperly-draining sink, left me disappointed with my stay and I will likely be looking for another hotel to stay when I visit Richmond again.

title: Great NYC hotel
comment: Been staying in NYC the past few years at various hotels. Can't beat the location, size of rooms, cleanliness of the Belvoir vs others. I have stayed here my past 3 trips and plan on doing so every trip going forward.

everyoneShouldKnow: The manager and staff really suck. Room should have had bath robe, never recieved after asking several times, and guest services give wrong information.
title: A very unhappy customer
comment: When checking in guest services told me one rate, but when I checked out it was another rate. Spoke with manager in duty and the issue wasn't resolved. 2nd, bathrobe was to be included with room never recieved after asking multiple times. 3rd, house keeping came in to clean room left only 3 big towels. No hand cloths or wash cloths. And, last the manger was rude. Had a yelling match with another customer in lobby with kids and other guest standing there. Which I thought was really unprofessional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient location and easy to find.
title: Not one thing to complain about
comment: Our stay was great. The beds are very comfortable, as always. Very clean hotel with a very friendly staff at affordable prices.

title: Nice but...
comment: The hotel was overall ok, the room was clean and the places to eat in the hotel were good.

title: Great location
comment: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The hotel was very busy, and there was a super long queue to check-in at 730pm on a Friday night. It appeared there were only 3 front desk staff handling check-in at the time, so the lines did not move quickly.

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: Clean, functional hotel. Platinum upgrade to Disney-view with balcony on top floor. Check-in clerk excellent. Massively exceeded expectations. Club Lounge food could be improved: poor breakfast selection and no vegetarian hors d'oeuvres.

title: Top Notch Staff, Older Rooms
comment: I travel here once a month and I'm always astonished by the front desk staff. Always cordial and on point, I've given out a few Platinum thank yous. It's a small part of the hotel experience, but starting off each visit with a great welcome goes a long way.

everyoneShouldKnow: It appears renovations are in the process. Maybe it will improve
title: Bad experience
comment: The lights went out so we had to walk up 4 flights of stairs. We were afraid to use the elevator after a guest said they had been stuck in them twice. Toilet overflowed and front desk asked if I wanted an engineer sent up instead of immediatley saying she would send someone up. Dirty facecloth left hanging over the shower curtain. Had been there so long it was stiff. Room has funny smell, cannot describe. Food served at conference was just okay

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel, but in a bad location
title: Nice Hotel, Bad Location
comment: This is a really nice hotel, but in a bad location. To get into town, one must take a taxi. To get anywhere, one must take a taxi.

everyoneShouldKnow: Located on the boardwalk and beach. Dog friendly.
title: Enjoyed the stay
comment: First time traveling with my dog and we had a great time at this hotel. Staff were very nice and rooms were clean. We loved being close to the boardwalk and beach. The only issue was the construction throughout the hotel. Workers in the hallway upset the dog. They were replacing the grass around the hotel with new sod so it was a challenge to find a potty spot close. This was particularly an issue after dark when I didn't want to walk far. And, there were a ton of workers in the way to get out to the boardwalk/beach. All in all, I hope this was an isolated situation and will try the hotel again in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has the best service anywhere
title: Best service anywhere!
comment: The Belvoir staff was unfailingly nice - everywhere I went in the hotel, a staff member greeted me with a smile and an offer of help. Southern hospitality at its finest!!! The facility was also wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: WONDERFUL & GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND CARE FROM ALL STAFF
title: Nice hotel, great staff!
comment: Guest services from front desk, bell service, restaurant service, etc were great!

title: get what you pay for
comment: I like to say the front desk staff was great: top of the line in help and customer care. The hotel looks great in the lobby but once in the rooms it was in great need of care. There was nothing to show that the room was clean. IE: no card or name of staff. The sheets had holes and stains on them. There were two towels that was all when we came in. For a suit room. The first time I called for more towels it took almost 40 min to get them and they only brought 2 when I asked for 4. Then the staff that brought them was just rude. I thanked him and he just walked away never talking to me or looking at me.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location and extremely nice personnel.
title: one of the finest in the world
comment: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay with you and would certainly stay again. All of the personnel were extremely courteous and very friendly. It was a pleasure staying with you.

everyoneShouldKnow: The balcony handrail is very fragile and appears unsafe. If you have small children watch out.
title: Memorial Weekend 2012
comment: I want to begin by saying that the entire staff at this Belvoir was awesome! From the janitor, restaurant staff, front desk, parking attendant, etc. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable, truly beyond exceptional staff! However the hotel itself lacks what the Belvoir name stands for. We stayed in a newly renovated Oceanfront room. The bathroom is very cheaply made and barely enough room for one person. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were crisp and quite clean but watch out for that balcony! The handrail is very scary!

title: Highly Recommend
comment: This was one of our most enjoyable hotel stays ever! We did choose the upgrade and loved the Lounge Benefit, as well as the room upgrade in the Tower. Fabulous stay! Perfect Location! So much to do!

everyoneShouldKnow: No locker room in the gym and pool
title: Pretty good but a few bumps
comment: I booked the club level-no free upgrade here-and liked the hotel very much. The club level was pretty empty and I was first told that there would be no breakfast which was a lot of the reason I booked the club level int he first place...then it turned out there was breakfast after all so that could have been handled better. the room was great,club amenities were welcome,staff very nice. But the gym and pool have no locker room,no plastic bags to put workout clothes in,no place to change at all. I wound up wearing my robe to and from the pool which was sort of uncomfortable since is in the lobby

title: Issues with shower
comment: Everything in the hotel was good except the service I received when I had no water in my shower. As a result I was late to a meeting. What was offered at that time were two bottles of water which I did not need as I was a club member. At check out the receptionist said she awarded me 2500 points when I complained of the service.

title: Great Location & Staff, but Very Loud
comment: This hotel is very nice and well designed. Staff was very friendly and I appreciate all their help. One downside is everytime I stay at Belvoir I am woken up by their overly loud SLAMMING doors. Due to the design of the hotel I expected it to be a bit quieter to enjoy sleeping in with their amazingly comfortable beds.

title: Fantastic Vacation
comment: My wife and I stayed for a week just before Memorial day. This was the most relaxing enjoyable vacation I have had in many years.

title: Nice
comment: Very nice business hotel.

title: dissappointed!
comment: The pool was small. Meal in restaurant was not liking to 3 out of 5 people and no accomodation was made for this. When third person arrived she was not given a room key even though the desk was notified upon my arrival she would be coming. This stay did not meet my expectations. The exception was the maid service. They were great!

title: great location, outdated hotel
comment: I love this hotel for its location. 2 minutes away from "work" and lots of restaurants to choose from by the mall. However, it needs some help being remodeled. The bathrooms are the worst, the showers don't work properly and seem that have been there for many years. Old tile and tubs as well. Not what you would expect from a BPG hotel.

title: Inconvenient for two business women together
comment: Room was not designed for 2 women attending business sessions. The long mirror by closets could not be used for make up/hair. Had to bring out small mirror to desk area for make up and crawl under desk to find outlet for curling iron. Very inconvenient.

everyoneShouldKnow: The shuttle from the airport was fast!
title: This hotel was great and right next to airport!
comment: We stayed just one night but the check-in was fast and the room was comfortable. We also ate at the hotel restaurant and it was good. Caught a drink at the bar as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location next to river and Ohio Falls park
title: Louisville convert
comment: From the first phone call to get the airport shuttle to the checkout process the Sherton Riverside provided an outstanding experience. Our Van driver was curteous and helpful about the local area. Checkin was a breeze easy and accompanied by happy smiling faces. Stayed on club floor, Hourdervous and breakfast was great. Service there when needed but not hovering. Great directions to Ohio Falls park -- don't miss it if you're in the area. Checkout easy and again happy smiling faces. Loved Louisville first time I'd ever spent any time there, will return and will stay at the Sherton Riverside. THANKS!

title: WNET, PBS in NYC, Ch 13
comment: Alone, amongst a plethora of available television channels, Channel Thirteen returned only a frozen image of Bill Moyers. A visit by two hotel techs confirmed our suspicion that the incoming signal was blocked. They promised to have it rectified. That was early evening 25 June; a day later it was still blocked. When we left, noon 27th, it was still blocked. Who doing this, and why?

title: Awesome Hotel experience
comment: This hotel is excellent! I would especially like to recognize Jimmy, one of the bellman who was very kind and extremely helpful to me. During my stay, anything I needed help with, he was there to help me in a very respectful and professional manner. He was much more friendly and helpful than the concierge desk. At one point during my stay, I went to ask a question at the concierge desk and the person standing there looked right passed me and ignored me, which was disappointing. It was not crowed, I was the only one standing there. Sorry, I don't have a name, but it was on 5/24 around 4:30pm - she had black hair and wore glasses. Hope you can fix that.

everyoneShouldKnow: Looks nice, but, does not have the customer service to match.
title: Not up to snuff
comment: Room description stated it was for 5 people, but truly only slept 4. My son had to sleep in a chair for two nights. Hotel staff was not sympathetic and did not fix this problem or seem to care since we had already paid in full. Came back to room after first day and tub was clogged and filthy. Tub was unclogged quickly but not cleaned. Kids swam in pool, however came out with scrapes. Pool is very rough on feet, hands and knees, when kids complain and come out bleeding, you know it's bad. Upon check out, staff did not care how our stay was...did not even ask. Handed them our comment card upon checkout and they took it without a word and without eye contact. Very Poor customer service. Will not be back for sure.

title: Slept like a baby
comment: Once you get past the crowds in the lobby waiting to check in - your experience will be delightful. The room was wonderful - it was quiet and cold. The bed is very comfortable. the staff very helpful & attentive. the one & only objection I had was the wait to check in. otherwise everything is perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: How close it is to everything in the San Juan Metro area and how great the room product is.
title: Always a pleasure
comment: Great place. Central to all attractions San Juan has to offer.

everyoneShouldKnow: The pool area is BEST for kids of all ages and even the Families with teens!
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: I have stayed at many Orlando, Florida hotels and this is by far MY BEST EXPERIENCE EVER! Rooms were nice, Facilities were great, Staff was EXCELLENT. We rented a Cabana for the day and let me tell you Melissa the server for us was EXCELLENT! The managers knew what they were doing when they hired Melissa! She was there for us ANYTIME we needed her! I would defiantly go back just because of her service with a smile!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Kinda funky, confusing layout, but excellent service. Great location if you are looking to walk around Palo Alto and Stanford.
title: Great hotel in Palo Alto
comment: I usually come twice a year to Palo Alto for business and always try to stay at the Belvoir. Their service staff are excellent- always giving service with a smile. Rooms are a reasonable rate, and the location is perfect for my business needs. A few minor quibbles- you have to go through the pool area with your luggage in tow to get to your room. That makes it kinda awkward, especially with patio bar seating also in the same area. (Hard to have a quite drink outdoors while kids are splashing in the pool.), but not really a big deal.

everyoneShouldKnow: nice view, close to eveything, very clean, food is great
title: nice place and good managers
comment: on Memorial day we stayed and had an issue with the air conditioning. however everything else was great. after we informed the managers that our air didnt work properly they worked with us to reach a fair deal for both parties. Great place to stay. If there was one thing i would say they needed either a larger pool or another small pool.

title: Off the street or Platinum member...I don't think they cared
comment: Let me say that I am a big fan of the Grandbourne properties and have been a platinum member for several years. However, the disparity in of service received at the various properties needs focus. I might as well had walked in off the street and begged for a room at this hotel. First of all, upon checking in I was told there were no upgrades available and I would be required to stay on a low floor with zero view. Fine. Not a big deal. However, my floor was on a separate elevator bank than the lounge. So I had to travel all the way down and back up to go to the lounge. Not a huge deal, but you would think they could accommodate me on the same set of floors with a common elevator bank. Secondly, the TV did not work well in my room (the picture was fuzzy). I told the desk, but it was never fixed. In addition, my room was conveniently located near the elevator and across from the ice machine to make for a very noisy background and it looked like every room on the floor had a paper in front of their door in the morning except my room. The final kicker was when it started to rain and I had to run out for a meeting. I called guest services and the Concierge to get an umbrella. Apparently there was not a single umbrella in the hotel to lend to a platinum guest. Maybe someone should be sent out to buy a dozen for a rainy day. Good idea? None of these items are a big deal in the large scope of things, but this lack of small services is a far cry from the type of attention paid to valuable customers at other properties.

title: For the Price and Location I Expected More
comment: Staff was very friendly, concierge and valet were active and helpful.

title: Great Stay!
comment: I loved my stay here! The setting was awesome, and the staff was very nice. I can't wait to stay here again next year!! It would be nice to have a continental breakfast, though.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a block from convention center
title: great food, ok service
comment: the restaraunt is wonderful, the front desk was great. cleaning staff just ok.

title: Hotel needs better communication
comment: Reception desk not clearly marked. Signage on desk made it look more like a concierge desk. Elevators not clearly identified as to which allow access to parking and which access rooms.

title: Service
comment: I was attending a conference at the World Congress Center. 2 weeks before I was leaving, I had surgery for a broken ankle and became no weight bearing. I was getting around on a scooter and crutches; the staff was nothing but accomodating. My meetings started at 6am and the staff took me to the Congress Center in the morning so that I would not have to navigate the angled, bumpy sidewalk in the dark. I was also able to change to a handicapped room without a problem. While the shower in that room needs a concave floor so you don't flood the bathroom, and a lower hook for the hand-held shower head, the room was perfect for my needs. I had a great stay and if going to Atlanta again would stay at this hotel.

title: Great place to stay in Portsmouth NH
comment: Front desk staff was great to deal with and most accommodating. I was there for a conference. Staff for the conference food service were extremely friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is centrally located to meet all your restaurant and shopping "wants".
title: Fantastic Belvoir!
comment: I love this hotel. It is the second time we've stayed here in less than a year! The staff are all professional - especially Michael, the gentleman who checked us in. We love the location, the rooms, pool and the BPG Member room. Wonderful experience in every way! We will come back again :-)

title: Dolphin Review
comment: We found roaches in our room. After we changed rooms, we found them again on the last day. We found several roaches in our luggage when we arrived at home.

everyoneShouldKnow: Worn out beds. and air does not work right.
title: Disappointed
comment: This was my second visit, The first one was in March and had a good room I guess, This time I was put in 717, The bed was high in middle and I was falling off bed all nite, the air was noisy and did not cool properly. The bed pillows got switched to soft pillows the second nite do not know why. We were really disappointed this time. This lobby was nice and parking free. They need to redo the hotel and get new beds.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have access to the club lounge, try and get a room on the 29th floor or higher so you don't have to switch elevators.
title: Disappointing Stay
comment: My two biggest issues with this hotel was the rude front desk and the construction noise I heard at night while trying to sleep. They really don't treat Platinum members well here. Didn't get any acknowledgement or upgrade. When I asked if I got a Platinum upgrade from the front desk upon check-in, they responded with "no" without checking if there was anything available or an explanation on why there was no upgrade. There were better rooms available per BPG.com so the hotel being sold out wasn't an issue. I asked if they put me on an BPG preferred floor, they said they didn't have any such floors.

title: This hotel's service needs great improvement
comment: This review will tell it like it is regarding the Belvoir at the Burlington Hotel and Conference Center. When I first learned my family would be staying at the Belvoir I was incredibly excited and spent much time learning about all the aspects of the hotel. Later when we were there I became incredibly disappointed and pissed off. The hotel was booked to capacity which is great for their business however horrible for any guests that chose to stay there. The hotel ran out of extra blankets. I thought they were joking at first. After I called down to the front desk to inquire about the blanket I HAD TO BE THE ONE TO CALL AGAIN! That should NOT happen at a high star, very Expensive hotel. The front desk never contacted me again to let me know that no in fact no blankets remained in the entire hotel.

title: I was surprised at additonal fees
comment: I paid with points & cash but once ther learned I must pay for parking if I have a car and internet even if I do not want it.. Now i wanted both so not so bad but was surprised that after using 4000 points my fee was sjut below what it would have bene had I paid the entire thing in cash. hotel room gr8 location, and view pool close due to algea..

title: Belvoir Mid-Town Minneapolis
comment: The accommodations were clean and a good value for the rate. The availability of complimentary parking and shuttle service was added value. The shortcoming and area for additional training is the front desk. The staff was lacking in client/customer service and attention to detail.

title: Great staff
comment: We were in Iowa City for a swim meet. Nancy checked us in but our room was not scheduled to be ready until normal check in time. She went above and beyond and found us a room that was ready immediately. It was convenient since we were traveling as a family. Great service. The location near the U of I swim facility was unbeatable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Seriously in need of repair... Outdated
title: Dissapointing at best...
comment: I have been a frequent traveler to Grandbourne properties across the mainland and Hawai'i over the last twenty years. This is the first time I've stayed at the Princess Kaiulani. The room I was given in the "tower" was by far the most outdated, decrepit, poorly maintained room I've ever stayed in. When I asked at the front desk for a better room, I was told that was the best they had to offer. THe paint was peeling on the door jams. Hardware was rusted. The sliding door barely able to open and rattled at the slightest wind. Carpet was dirty. Chrome was worn off bathroom fixtures. The list is endless... As a gold member, not to mention the fact that I converted American Express points to Starpoints to facilitate my stay (at 3 Amex points to 1 Starpoint!) I feel I was completely ripped off and if I could get my points back I would. I had no other option but to endure my 9 days or misery. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and view of New York City.
title: Great location and attentive staff
comment: I had requested an early checkin but upon arrival our room was not yet ready. The lady at the checkin noted that we had been upgraded to a corner suite on the 9th floor but that it was not yet ready; we had the option of taking a regular room but knowing the view from a corner suite I declined. As we had engagements in New York we left our luggage and requested that it be moved to our room. When we returrned that evening our room was great (unbelieveable view of the New York skyline) and our luggage was there -:). We have stayed in this hotel a number of times and have always had great service and platinum recognition. The staff is always friendly and very helpful.

title: Good Stay
comment: Hotel is a good choice in the area. The rates can at times be a bit over the top, but if one gets a good rate then certainly stay. Ahuge negative is the upcharge for WIFI, even if one is a Grandbourne Preferred Guest. With so many hotels and restaurants offering free WIFI, trying to engage a customer with this service charge leaves a negative impact.

title: lack of staff
comment: The room was great and comfortable. but when we arrived it took us almost an hour to check in. The line was long and there was only two people behind the desk. The were numerous other employees just standing around watching but none of them helped out the front desk to make the line go faster. We had dinner reservations and ended up having to rush because of the long wait. When we checked in the lady told us there was a buffet in the morning and she would give us a voucher for our long wait. When we went to breakfast the next morning thinking it was free we were blindsided by them telling us there was no voucher and we owed $70 for breakfast. Rooms were nice but i would not reccomend to my friends.

title: Pleasant Stay
comment: I stayed here with my son for a baseball tournament. Everything was wonderful.

title: Great location and stay!
comment: Michael and his staff met and exceeded our expectations. Hotel was very nice and conveniently located. We've been staying recently at a nearby property when in Dallas. However, we'll stay at the Belvoir again.

title: Great Stay
comment: Front desk staff, especially Olivia, were wonderful to work with (met all requests from early check in to high floor). We had six rooms that were on the beach. Though renovations were on-going we did not experience any noise or inconvenience. Housekeeping service was excellent. Location is fabulous at the quiet, less crowded section of the beach. Thank you!

everyoneShouldKnow: You cannot find a better location!
title: Great Location But Small Room
comment: We are BPG Gold members and paid for Club Floor Amenities, even though we were not given a Club Floor room. In fact, our room was so crowded that we had to stand on a chair to raise and lower the shade. We have stayed here twice before and had much better accommodations. The servers manning the Club Room for breakfast were excellent, but the ones in the evening were not. In fact, when the food ran out, that was it, even crackers! We would like to suggest adult hours for the pool. As late as 9:40 PM, adults could not even have a conversation by the pool because there were so many screaming, splashing children. I know this is not the hotel's fault, but adult-only hours could help to alleviate this problem. I also know we were not the only ones affected by this since others in the elevator discussed their leaving for the same reason. The morning we left, we needed a cab just before 7 AM. No one was outside except a member of the cleaning crew. He kindly stopped and asked if we needed a cab. He then whistled for one and refused to take a tip. I so wish I had gotten his name because he was very kind and did a job that was not his own.

title: Worst Stay Ever
comment: Without a doubt my worst stay ever at a Grandbourne Property! Where do I begin?

title: exceeded my expectations
comment: Great location- We were there for my daughter's birthday. The hotel was immacuuatly clean, hotel staff was completely attentive and professional. This is the best hotel, I have stayed at in NYC. -Thank you for everthing!!

title: LA Memorial Weekend Trip
comment: Hotel on the hill in the los angeles area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Manager and staff are extremely accommodating. Great location on the lakeside and good restaurants nearby the property. The Tomato Palace was so convenient with great food.
title: A beautiful hotel and great staff
comment: Thank you to Derrick, the manager on duty last weekend, and his wonderful, friendly staff. My daughter and I had a beautiful king sized bedroom overlooking the lake. It was spacious, clean and had an air purifier which was highly effective. We had a very nice breakfast in the club lounge with excellent service. There was no extra charge for allowing our shih tzu to stay with us. I definitely look forward to staying again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent staffing from front desk to housekeeping
title: The room was excellent
comment: The room was excellent and had a lot of room to move around, although it surprised me that there was not a microwave in a junior king suite. Second, the staff was overwhelmingly wonderful in every aspect. My only complaint would be that the bed on both the king bed and the sleeper sofa where terrible, however I did not complain because the staff made this a good stay as well as the location and amenities were very good.

title: Outstanding
comment: This particular Belvoir was outstanding. The room was exceptional. The staff was very professional. The entire experience was an experience.

title: Great Hotel Experience
comment: This is a great property for when you don't want to spend $350+ per night staying at a Disney Hotel (always the best choice for special occasions) What we like about this property are: 1~ The proximity to Disneyland (about a 15 minute walk from your room to the front gate). 2~ All the dining choices within walking distance... from a Morton's Steakhouse across the parking lot, to the attached Overland Stage BBQ restaurant/bar & Molly's Kitchen for early (6:00am) breakfasts & lunches.. Plus all kinds of good dining choices 1 block up Katella at the Garden Walk Mall (Roy's Hawaiian Fusian, Bubba Gump's, Cheesecake Factory, etc) 3~ The pool area is nicely done (see the pics) surrounded by Palm trees giving it a tropical vibe. The Pool Bar serving better than normal bar fare to eat and mixing nice drinks.4~ They have a pretty nice Gym & they don't charge their guests a $20.00 fee like the Hilton does at their 5 star gym. 6~ The Heavenly beds are very comfortable 7~ The Club Lounge has good breakfast & appetizer fare. 8~ Full Balconies overlooking California Adventure park (request them, some are only partial) great to have evening cocktails and watch the sun go down. 9~ One of the Best views of the Disney Fireworks display from your own private Balcony on the top floor..and 10~ Friendly and attentive Staff throughout the hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: There are two parking exits, the back one is helpful to hop onto Katella
title: Great location
comment: Great location for a Disneyland visit, also well placed for most visits in the OC. Have stayed here twice now, friendly staff, great beds and pillows. A microwave would be helpful for people staying longer.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Very nice, clean hotel. Super friendly staff!! Loved it!!

title: Great customer service!!!!!
comment: Great customer service!!!!!

title: So many things need improving...
comment: Bathroom needed updating, elevators were broken so lines were long, parking charge was excessive and vehicle return was chaotic.

title: Great Hotel Staff
comment: Had a great time at this Belvoir in Jeffersonville. Staff was super and and able to get everything we needed. If I was in town again this would be the place for me to stay.

title: more accomodations at cheaper hotels
comment: Check in was at 3pm i wasn't allowed to check in until 5pm. I was told there were refrigerators in the rooms when I made the reservation. I arrived and was told only the suites had refrigerators. The "club" upgrade wasn't worth the price. The upgrade allowed you access to a "club room" that had complimentary food. The food was terrible. Because of the layout of the hotel any room that faced the pool had an echoing effect to anyone who was in the pool or on their balcony's that would keep you up all night. The rooms had very little soundproofing. I could hear my neighbors conversations. I've stayed in hotels half the price that provided refrigerators in the rooms, a full complimentary breakfast and quiet rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very attentive staff assure your needs are met!!!
title: Better than the review!!
comment: I read the reviews for the hotel before I arrived and wasn't expecting much. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised! The service was excellent! the wait staff went out of their way to be sure our needs were met. The bed and pillows were great and provided a restful sleep. We commend the manager ALL of the wait staff and especially Mel, Robert and Summer for excellent service!

title: great view of the planes landing from the club lounge
comment: i enjoyed the sereness of the lobby area with its water feature, natural lighting and fresh flowers - great area to read and grab a cup of coffee. even though it is an airport hotel i did not experience any jet noise from my room or the lobby. it is an older hotlel and did notice a few bruises on the property but the staff was gracious and accomandating - first impressions are often lasting impressions and LaSonja at the front desk hit a homerun. a major problem for me was the fitness center - no free weights or kettle balls - not everyone is that into cardio - and was a bit puzzled why the bathroom door was locked - had to leave the fitness center. overall, enjoyed my stay at a great price.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is no additional fee for parking, and Interstates 580, 680, and the BART are only seconds away.
title: Good Value doesn't always imply Good Experience
comment: Perhaps the primary purpose of hotels in this geographic area is to serve Safeway and other neighboring corporations. However, this particular property falls short of most if not all Belvoir standards. From exterior appearance to in-room temperature control, this facility falls well below BPG Category 2 standards and likely does not deserve to be branded with the Belvoir name. Multiple back-to-back stays point to an under-trained staff that fails to do what they say they're going to do by when they say they're going to do it. Still, for the price point associated with early booking, this property is generally a good value. It is great for Safeway corporate guests, and great for access to Stoneridge Mall.

title: Great Location
comment: There is no need to stay in the city, especially now that the ferry at the hotel runs on the weekends. The free buses that await you at the pier can take you to most of the subway locations that you would need. It is so nice to return to the quiet location of the hotel at the end of the day. Also, you have the million dollar view of the Manhattan skyline. If you need help, ask for Hector. He is great! Beware of long waits at the restaurant at dinner time. Reservations don't mean much.

title: Excellent Customer Service
comment: I was am patient at UT Southwestern and had to stay an extra day for some additional testing. The staff was amazing. They made a difficult day just a little bit easier. I have to travel a lot to UTSW. I live over 4 hours away from the hospital and I was by myself. I am very grateful. The hotel was safe, affordable, close to the hospital and the customer service was to be commended. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Only stay here if there are no other hotels in Bricktown.
title: Great Location, poor hotel.
comment: The Belvoir's location is great and just a few minutes from all Bricktown activities. Move this hotel anywhere else and they would call it a Motel 6, except Motel 6's room have a refrigerator and microwave. Our room's carpet was old, bathroom was very small, and the HDTV only had a SD signal. Some of the channels were not even viewable due to the reception. The staff was rude in the breakfast area and quite slow. Breakfast was actually decent and the omlet chef was excellent! I will definately find somewhere else to stay next time we want to visit Bricktown.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask when remodel is taking place
title: Remodel needed
comment: It appears from the design story boards in the lobby that this location is due for a remodel - they best hurry before losing Grandbourne clients. Used points for stay on club floor - below average and no free wi-fi in rooms? Even the budget hotels today offer free wi-fi, maybe they are paying for the remodel with the $10 fee. Hotel elevators old, small and scarry, tired furnishings and club room breakfast mediocre at best. Grandbourne booking claimed robes in room - not there, claimed free wifi - assumed in room but was only accessed from "club room". Free is not always good. icing on the cake - ice machine - 1 per floor was a mile away and not working (maybe because next to room 666)

title: Wonderful staff found and shipped me my jewelry
comment: Outstanding staff at this hotel. During our stay they accommodated all our requests (e.g. 2 cribs). After we left I realized I had left my travel kit behind, complete with a gold bracelet and other items ranging from expensive to sentimentally valuable to time-consuming to replace inside. The staff contacted me the next day to report they had found it, and promptly shipped it back to me via FedEx. I got everything back! Tremendously impressed with the honesty and professionalism of the housekeeping and other staff at this hotel. Thank you Belvoir Iowa City!

title: Extremely Disappointing
comment: Nothing close to what we expected or experienced. Lousy attitude at the front desk; surly servers poolside; horrible fish smell every time we got on or off the elevator. What a disappointment after so many years as an BPG Gold member.

everyoneShouldKnow: No elevator in the lodge, you must carry luggage up and down stairs.
title: SOME OK SOME NOT
comment: The location of this hotel is excellent! Within walking distance to an amazing mall with food and entertainment. It is in a wooded area that is beautiful. Our room was in the lodge section, which is set in the woods further. The parking was free which is an added benefit. The unfortunate problem was that there wasn't a ramp, an incline to pull your luggage up or for handicap assistance that we could find. And your rooms are either downstairs or upstairs, ours' was downstairs and there isn't an elevator in the lodge (I checked with the front desk) and it is very inconvenient to lug your luggage up and down steps!! Our room was enormous and near the laundry, a big plus! It was beautiful with an huge desk and full size sleeper sofa, beautifully furnished. Yet another problem was that in our bathroom (room 166) there was only hot, very hot water in the tub/shower. I complained to the front desk and they said they would send an engineer down to fix it while we were gone for the day. We had 3 nights total stay (May 25th-27th and 27th-28th, 2 different bookings using cash and points but all in the same room), the engineer never showed up during our stay. And due to no elevator and ramp, it was difficult to change rooms. At checkout, after several tries to get all my receipts, I was almost offered a free breakfast, I was asked if I ate, but I was on my way to my flight and had no time, I think the front desk was going to offer me a meal but I'll never know. As beautiful as it was, and as close of a location to family as it was, it had it's draw backs.

title: Memorial Weekend 2012
comment: When we arrived on Friday, they were still working on getting the pool open. Pool did open in the afternoon, wish they had cleaned the pool deck, it was full of sand and dirt the whole weekend. Also, the foot wash station was not working so everyone who came from the beach got sand all in the pool. Yuck! Also, not being able to bring outside food and drinks to the pool area is ridiculous. Trying to keep my kids hydrated at the pool is hard enough without having to pay crazy amounts to get a water!

title: Location, Location, Location
comment: Great location if you like being in the heart of it all and all attactions closeby within walking distance.

title: Nice but fix the A/C
comment: I like staying at this hotel. It has a great location and the hotel is nice and clean and the staff is always helpful and pleasant. The only thing that needs attention is the A/C in the room. It did not work and the room was stuffy and uncomfortable. The only time the room was cool was in the morning for about 1 hour. The control unit on the wall did not work which makes me wonder if it's there for show.

title: This hotel has the comforts of home
comment: I have never gone to a hotel and the staff goes above and beyond to meet my need. Spaces were kept on the shuttle for us. The young lady that checked me in had the best personality. The bed was wonderful and the pillows even better.

title: Excellent Belvoir
comment: Everything was great. The Club lounge had great snacks in the evening, and an equally great breakfast in the morning. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and quiet. We have stayed at numerous Belvoir's around the country and this Hotel rates up at top.
