everyoneShouldKnow: THE AIR CONDITIONING BARELY WORKS. THE HOTEL IS HOT, HOT, HOT!!!!! UNBEARABLE! DIRTY HALLS AND CARPETS, NOT WELL MAINTAINED!
title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!
comment: The hotel is rundown, carpets are filthy, the rooms are incredibly warm and air conditioning does not work properly. The temperature in the rooms is sweltering!!!!!! The water pressure in the shower is pitiful. Ice machines on every other floor. Really?!?!? How this hotel is a Belvoir is beyond me. It is the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. Do not stay here, no matter how cheap it is. It is not worth even one dollar.

everyoneShouldKnow: It goes above and beyond to meet your expectations.
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: I love this hotel. This was my 4th time staying there within 2 years. Very convenient to Freeways and shopping. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. My children love the pool and waterslide. We will be back again and again.

title: Great location and super friendly staff
comment: Every member of the staff that I spoke with was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was great for a family stay. I did request a crib for our room prior to arriving and did not get it, we also got stuck by the stair door and was told they would not beable to switch to another room. Neither issue impacted us too much.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Villas are beautiful and have everything you need.
title: Nice Surprise
comment: We were on an 11 day driving vacation through Colorado and Wyoming. We had not planned on stopping in the Vail area but we needed a rest and were looking for a nice place. We found the Belvoir Villas and stayed for two nights. It was the shoulder season so the room rates were great. The villa was very nice. We had everything we needed and the bonus of having a washer and dryer in our villa meant that I got to return home without dirty laundry. Loved our stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Proximity to Epcot, the Boarkwalk, and the Studios
title: Great Location - Sub par Food Option
comment: The proximity to Epcot, the Boardwalk and Hollywood Studios is great. The shuttles to downtown disney and other parks are convienent so you don't need a car but it can take a LONG time (1hr+).

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is good but service is lacking.
title: Needs help with housekeeping
comment: I recommend this hotel only because the location was great and the price was right.

title: Excellent location, average staff
comment: Upsides: The spot is secluded, tucked away on Sand Key that attracts relatively well-off crowd, and removed from the hustle and bustle of even a couple of miles up on Gulf Dr. The view from my standard BPG room was fantastic, with the expanse of the white sands. Children's play area and the beach were easily accessible. The view from the fitness center on 9th floor was great.

title: THIS HOTEL HAD NO AIR CONDITIONING
comment: GOT STUCK IN THE ELEVATOR, AIR CONDITIONING IN ROOM DID NOT WORK

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay here with a sports group.
title: horrible for sports groups
comment: Traveled with a soccer club 250+ kids

title: Comfortable Beds
comment: I was surprise to see that the bed was so comfortable, I wanted to take it home with me because I slept so well. Also was glad to see that you allowed pets at no additional cost.

everyoneShouldKnow: In the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and all the action - if you like that...
title: No Club Lounge
comment: I just stayed at the hotel for the Anniversary of the Golden Gate Bridge and was very dissapointed to find out the hotel has no Club Lounge. And the "breakfast" offered as Platinum Amenity would have been a "boxed breakfast" and not a "sit-down breakfast". Happily the emberassed front desk member warned me about this when I made my decission.

title: Erroneous Charge Issue Outstanding
comment: I am trying to get Belvoir Brooklyn Accounting to take off erroneous charge posted to room...no luck. I would rate this hotel much higher, but my employer (Chase) needs me to settle my bill. I never ate at the hotel restaurant.and never do at any hotel unless I have no alternative.

title: Gold BPG
comment: Stayed here twice in May first stay was perfect second stay not so much, but I will give them credit when it comes to upgrades for Gold BPG they did a nice job with that.

title: Nicely renovated
comment: I have stayed at this hotel before renovation and it really needed some work.

everyoneShouldKnow: Super clean hotel, friendly staff, and a super deal on point redemption for what you receive!
title: Best hotel in Anaheim area
comment: Hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. Rooms were immaculate, staff was super friendly, and the point redemption was amazing for the quality of the hotel. We will definitely be staying here again during our visits to Disney and Knotts Berry Farm. Great hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to request a fridge (and pay for it) and the rooms are VERY small. Most of the general staff at the hotel seem to be past retirement age with very little patience or energy.
title: Front Desk Staff Very Rude
comment: The property is very nice, although the rooms are very small and outdated. The worst part of any visit to this property is the rudeness of the front desk staff...they are very unfriendly, not willing to assist or answer questions and are ALWAYS condescending. Once you get past the check-in process, the rest of your stay will be fantastic. I have stayed here over 10 times and it is ALWAYS the same scenario.

title: Front Desk disappoints
comment: Have enjoyed this Belvoir in the past but was disappointed by the front desk on two counts:

title: Excellent stay
comment: Entire staff committed to highest level of service. Amazing value for staying so close to Uptown and Downtown. Was a welcomed Platinum guest. Would only recommend if at all possible an upgrade to the Club lounge food/beverage offerings. The breakfast was unappealing and very crowded (is this really only for qualified guests, or open access) and in the evening there was no beer/wine available even for purchase.

title: Unsatisfactory experience
comment: After staying at other Grandbourne establishments & previously a Sherton on a Club floor, this experience compared to the others was underwhelming. The room was small, with walls and carpeting in need of repair. The club lounge felt like an extension of the elevator lobby. The Hors D'oeuvres Were poor at best. At checkout, no luggage racks were available nor was any assistance offered. For this, I spent a premium rate. I will be staying in St Louis and Cleveland at the Club floors and hope they are a major improvement.

title: Great Stay!
comment: Staff and facility made my business stay very pleasant. Staff was courtious, friendy and very professional. I would recommond hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: They may not have your reserved rooms ready when you arrive. And they are slow to offer any compensation.
title: Rooms Not Ready and No Communication
comment: Upon arrival at 6pm, my two rooms were not available. The front desk staff said no rooms were available but housekeeping should have something reading in a few hours. My wedding party needed something immediately to drop our stuff and change prior to a 7pm dinner reservation, so 8 of us were forced to change in a small king-sized-bed room. I requested the front staff to call and notify me when our rooms would be ready; they took my number and agreed. I never received a phone call, and later that evening when we returned to the hotel, I had to re-explain the situation to the front desk staff to claim our rooms. After receiving our new room keys, our group went back to our single temporary room to gather our belongings, except our key cards no longer worked and someone else was in the room. Turns out the hotel staffed moved all of our belongings into the new hotel rooms without notifying me as they previously agreed to. This is unnacceptable. They did not have our rooms ready, there was no communication, and they management did not have our permission to move our belongings. They screwed up big time. I will never use book with Belvoir hotels ever again.

title: This hotel has great public relations skills
comment: I found the hotel to be very adaquate, The rooms were nice, the hotel staff is surperb

title: The family package free upgrade is great
comment: The family castle package is a good deal. We like the size of the one-bedroom suite although the doorway is too narrow and the bathroom is too small. The shuttle bus is also too crowdy coming back from the park. Needs more frequent shuttle.

title: Unsatisfactory staff
comment: As a platinum member I was disappointed to find this hotel would not recognize my status. I was denied access to the lounge, but after some haggling, my room was upgraded. I was told this hotel would not recognize my platinum status because I booked through a third party. This was the first time I heard of this news considering I booked through a third party three times within the last month for BPG hotels. I would not stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Odd number rooms on the higher floors offer the best view in the city
title: Exceptional Experience
comment: As a business traveler my lodgings are very important. The Downtown Belvoir satifies the highest standards a traveler like myself requires. They offer great accomodations, excellent food, phenominal service. The staff, from the parking garage through the wait staff, to everyone you encounter on the property is wonderfully friendly and helpful. I will not consider another location when I am in the Philadelphia area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Always accomodating and we always feel like we are at home away from home!
title: Always a pleasure!!!!
comment: Belvoir Boston is amazing! Everyone makes us feel at home here from check-in to check out!! Chandra always greets us with a smile when we check in!! Thank you Belvoir Boston!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Arguably the best location in downtown/bricktown area.
title: Good Contender in Crowded Market
comment: We've stayed at several hotels in downtown OKC and this Belvoir stands out in a good way. Location: ideal. Front desk folks: consistently helpful. Room: clean and comfortable. (Fave part: instant hot water in the shower.) Restaurant: surprisingly tasty. Lobby bar: late night gem with amazing food. Small quibbles: TV had poor reception, both beds rocked/shifted, and $2 charge for in-room bottled water (at room temperature!).

title: One night stay, disappointed
comment: I redeemed Starpoints for a 1 night stay at the Baltimore BWI, as I had a cruise leaving the port the next day. The hotel is convenient to the airport and the shuttle driver was very friendly and professional. However, the front desk attendant was unfriendly upon check in. I asked what my breakfast options were for the next morning, since each hotel is different with the platinum benefit. He told me I wasn't platinum in a condescending tone. The whole conversation was generally condescending and unfriendly. I corrected him and resolved the situation, but the manner he spoke to me in at first was very unprofessional and unnecessary. The room was okay. I was traveling with my girlfriend and two others and shared just one room. The beds are tiny for two people, just double beds. The layout of the room and bathroom was a little odd, but it was clean and good size. For breakfast we ate in the Belvoir Club. In one word, awful. The quality and selection was poor. (1 picked over fruit plate, a few pieces of bread/bagels for toast, and some dry scrambled eggs). The attendant was uninterested and was watching the Fresh Prince of Bel Air and later the a special on Soul Train on the Club's TV during breakfast service. The service we received was just not acceptable. I think the hotel has a lot of potential because the overall property is nice, but the service was not anywhere near Grandbourne's standard.

everyoneShouldKnow: The most attentive, friendliest staff anywhere!
title: Far Exceeded My Expectations
comment: I don't know where to start. For so long I missed having an BPG hotel in Stamford. This hotel opened up and it has surpassed anything I could have expected. The staff is exceptional. From the front desk to the Club Lounge hostess, the janitorial staff, the employees you meet in the hallway. Everyone was warm, friendly, smiling. We were checking out, my five year old son had a frown, and the front desk attendant ( how could I have forgotten her name!) stopped what she was doing to inquire what was wrong. He told her he was hungry, and she went and got him a snack! By the way, the wait staff at the restaurant is great! Definitely will stay there again. I stayed in a suite, and it was bigger than a NYC apartment.
